Date: Today, 3rd January
Time: 2:00pm

Full List of @APCWAY2019 Campaign Team 

https://t.co/km1tfEa23u https://t.co/DSFjkb5q3h

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In spite of the challenges we’ve had, people in the North East know that we have recorded remarkable improvement in the fight against Boko Haram. There is no doubt that we will fully overcome these challenges and win the war against terrorism in Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
I wish you all a Happy 2019. 

Thank you and God Bless the Federal Republic of Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
We are moving from potentials to actualization, and it is a task to be accomplished by us all; man, woman, young, old, military, civilian, all Nigerians.
Please come along, as we journey to the land of our dreams.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: A New Year provides opportunity for renewal of commitment, and I invite you to rededicate yourselves to the vision of a Nigeria that works for all.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I can assure you all that we are making steady and sustainable progress in all areas of national life. Those who are unbiased can see and appreciate the progress the country has made since 2015.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are motivated by nothing other than service to motherland, and service without selfishness or personal interest.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I appreciate your support and collaboration in previous years, and look forward to same in 2019, and beyond, as I hope you will renew the mandate you overwhelmingly gave us in 2015, for another term.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We have had our challenges: security, economic, political, social. But we are resolved to combat and overcome them all.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are on this mission together, and I assure you of a firm commitment to the ideals of a safe, secure, fair, just and prosperous country.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are resolved to build a country in which the resources are utilized for the benefit of the largest number, and not appropriated by a privileged few in their never-ending quest to satisfy their greed.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: That is the journey we have embarked on since we came onboard in 2015, and we are not distracted as we move on.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigerians desire peace, security, prosperity, inclusiveness and infrastructural development, a nation they can be proud of, a country that can hold its own among the nations.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Those who continue to trumpet falsehood and negativity are on their own, fighting a losing battle. The greater number of Nigerians are trusting and believing that we shall deliver on our promises for a level playing field at the polls, and that is what we shall do.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Elections need not be a do-or-die affair, and we should not approach that eventuality in a democracy with trepidation and mortal fear. Happily, a large number of presidential candidates have committed to peace, and peace we shall have.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As I welcome you into 2019, I also reiterate my many promises and declarations that the general elections will be free, fair and credible.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 2019 will be an election year for us. In about two months, the polls are due, and we will elect leaders into various offices, at national and state levels.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The dawn of a New Year is also a time to look forward. To consider new prospects, unfold our plans, and prepare for landmark dates and events.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: A time like this offers precious opportunity for thanksgiving, stock taking and reflection on goals and targets set for the receding year, and how much was accomplished. The ones not done can then be rolled over into a new year.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We Nigerians are a religious people, and we believe that God reigns and rules in the affairs of men.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: At the turn of every year, we often use the opportunity to look back at the past and forward to the future. To review the outgoing year, its high and low points, successes and failures, and be fully thankful to God.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It is my utmost pleasure to rejoice with all Nigerians as we enter the year 2019, which will be a very significant one for Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I paid a condolence visit to the family of former President Shehu Shagari, in Sokoto. May his soul rest in peace, and may Almighty Allah comfort the family. https://t.co/1JFhYAfYAi

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I pray that Almighty God will comfort his family and all who mourn him, and grant his soul eternal rest.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I mourn the departure of a patriot, who served Nigeria with humility, integrity and diligence. Nigerians held him in the highest esteem even when he was out of office, until his demise, and will forever miss his wise counsels.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On behalf of my family, the government and the people of Nigeria, it is with immense sadness that I received the news of the passing away of the first Executive President of Nigeria, Alhaji Shehu Shagari.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @ProfOsinbajo: 200 Million people - innumerable ideas, limitless possibilities, wondrous abilities.

By investing in Nigerians, we are e…
retweet_text:
200 Million people - innumerable ideas, limitless possibilities, wondrous abilities.

By investing in Nigerians, we are ensuring a stable and growing Nigeria for Nigerians,
A thriving Nigeria for Africa,
A prospering Nigeria for the world

Merry Christmas Nigerians, you matter! https://t.co/PoXZDRXBfC

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
At Christmas we reflect on the humble, symbolic and divine birth of a young child thousands of years ago in Bethlehem, Judea; and the message of hope, compassion, salvation, reconciliation, forgiveness and peace that Jesus Christ embodies and conveys.

Merry Christmas to All! https://t.co/8b09OxYXcp

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I‘m also happy to note the progress being made in our airports and sea-ports on the implementation of the Executive Order on the Ease of Doing Business. We have a duty to ensure that travellers in & out of Nigeria get the best,not just in terms of infrastructure, but also service https://t.co/2eCHwuxBye

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our administration has a deliberate policy to close Nigeria’s significant infrastructural deficit. And so today I opened the new Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport Terminal, the first Airport Terminal to be connected to a rail transport system in Nigeria, and in West Africa. https://t.co/WhyQ4zjjno

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I assumed the birthday surprises were over — only for me to travel for the 60th Anniversary of the formal Proclamation of the Republic of Niger, and face a second ambush. I’m very grateful to everyone who honored me today. May Almighty Allah reward you all abundantly. https://t.co/13OknvupXe

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: What the incumbents at the time used to do was just to award votes, and then tell anyone who was dissatisfied to go to court. But we won't do that. I am prepared to give the opposition the opportunities I was not given in the past.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I told them that having run for president three times, ending up at the Supreme Court all three times, before God and technology - PVCs and Card Readers - made a way for me the fourth time, I know what it is to be cheated at the polls.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I received a delegation from the International Republican Institute and the National Democratic Institute, USA, here to assess our pre-election preparations. It was an opportunity for me to again assure that I will ensure a level playing field for all contestants in 2019.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @ProfOsinbajo: To a man, who has been exemplary in life and his commitment to Nigeria,

To a man who has a great sense of humour,

To a…
retweet_text:
To a man, who has been exemplary in life and his commitment to Nigeria,

To a man who has a great sense of humour,

To a man who genuinely loves the Nigerian people and to a man I am privileged to call Boss, Happy 76th Birthday! https://t.co/qOwBU6aaLm

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We have made our priorities clear, and we will also make clear the progress we are achieving. Nothing will come in the way of our determination to bring lasting change to Nigeria, and to lay the foundation for lasting peace and prosperity.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our efforts in social investment and human capital development, after years of neglect and under-investment. Our emphasis on fighting corruption, which has earned us global support and recognition; and the ongoing determination to tackle various inherited security challenges.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will continue to remind Nigerians of the situation we met the country in, in 2015, and what we have been able to achieve since then, with the resources available to us. Our unparalleled focus on Infrastructure, delivering transport, power and water projects across the country.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: A journalist asked me what Nigerians should expect from me, as I turn 76. I am thankful to God for keeping me going, I will continue to serve Nigeria with all dedication and commitment. This is the only country we have, and we will make it work.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I‘m very grateful to everyone for their kind wishes on my 76th birthday today. Those who ambushed me at the State House with a surprise celebration, and all of you who sent in greetings from around the country and the world. Thank you very much. May the Almighty God bless you all https://t.co/9wDDiJjaMi

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our communities must be ready to live together in peace — no development can take place in an atmosphere of recurring violence. Law and order must be allowed to prevail in these affected communities.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I commend the Cross River State Government and the State Police Commend for acting swiftly to prevent the violence in Biase Local Government Area from escalating. There is no justification whatsoever for the bloodshed and destruction of property.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I can assure you all that this is the real me. Later this month I will celebrate my 76th birthday. And I’m still going strong!

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Poor @ProfOsinbajo, even he had to deal with the rumours — Some people reached out to him to consider them to be his Vice President because they assumed I was dead. That embarrassed him a lot; we discussed it when he visited me while I was convalescing.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: One of the questions that came up today in my meeting with Nigerians in Poland was on the issue of whether I‘ve been cloned or not. The ignorant rumours are not surprising — when I was away on medical vacation last year a lot of people hoped I was dead. https://t.co/SHTngq6LJU

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I commend the coaching crew, the Nigeria Football Federation (NFF), the Supporters Club and all football-loving Nigerians for the hard work and the support given to our heroic Super Falcons. I have never doubted the capacity of Nigerians to excel when given the right support.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations to the Super Falcons on their #AWCON18 victory over the Banyana Banyana of South Africa tonight. First they qualified for the World Cup in France next year, then tonight added the icing on the cake: winning AWCON for the 3rd consecutive time, and 9th time overall.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On Wednesday, at the Chief of Army Staff Annual Conference, I was presented with a compilation of photographs from my military career. From cadet to General, even my time at the US Army War College. I seized the opportunity to take the audience on a journey down memory lane. https://t.co/Sn7qBHSLSF

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today’s Meeting also provided an opportunity to reiterate our message to the Military: We will ensure you have the equipment you need to optimally function. Your welfare will continue to remain our priority. And together we shall restore the Lake Chad Region to its glorious days. https://t.co/h0CwRmEFYq

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We know that the crisis is being fueled by poverty and the continued shrinkage of the Lake Chad, which have rendered the people vulnerable to terrorist activities. This is why we must actualize efforts to recharge the Lake, through Inter-Basin Water Transfer from the Congo Basin.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We must not allow the enemies of the region to succeed in their quest to destabilize the area. We must reinvigorate our collective will & commitment towards eradicating terrorism from our region. We must & will remain focused and true to ensuring sustainable peace and development

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Boko Haram’s increasing use of mines as well as its recent deployment of Unmanned Aerial Vehicles for surveillance activities have proved to be critical factors in the resurgence of attacks in the region. Times as these call for quick interventions & measures. We must not relent!

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today in N'djamena, Chad, I chaired a Meeting of Heads of State and Government of the Lake Chad Basin Commission (LCBC). I reiterated my commitment to providing the required leadership and direction for the actualization of peace and security in the Lake Chad Region. https://t.co/1AiKMWCBt0

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @ProfOsinbajo: The market women, road sellers, artisans and others make up the informal sector. While they remain largely invisible, the…
retweet_text:
The market women, road sellers, artisans and others make up the informal sector. While they remain largely invisible, their contributions to the economy is undebatable.

They are Nigerians and they have a right to the resources of Nigeria. https://t.co/4qc5yRrpL4

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @ProfOsinbajo: In Jigawa today, I visited the Kasuwan Tipa and Dutse modern markets to monitor the ongoing disbursement of Trader Moni l…
retweet_text:
In Jigawa today, I visited the Kasuwan Tipa and Dutse modern markets to monitor the ongoing disbursement of Trader Moni loans. 

Trader Moni is one of the distinct loan products of GEEP that seeks to boost the informal sector by enumerating and empowering key players with loans. https://t.co/p7c93lDQs2

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @ProfOsinbajo: President Muhammadu Buhari and I believe unequivocally, that the resources of Nigeria must be used for Nigerians. It must…
retweet_text: President Muhammadu Buhari and I believe unequivocally, that the resources of Nigeria must be used for Nigerians. It must be available to farmers, the traders, those who need jobs, the young, the old and everyone in between.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I would like to reassure our Military that as their Commander-In-Chief, I will do everything within my power to continue empowering them by providing all the necessary equipment and force multipliers required for them to prevail on the field. https://t.co/Gvek9LFkA1

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today in Maiduguri I visited our wounded troops. Across the Northeast we have  officers and men fighting bravely and tirelessly to keep our country safe from terrorism and violence. I salute their sacrifice on our behalf. And may the souls of the fallen rest in peace. https://t.co/SLukJVJTab

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have invited the presidents of the LCBC member countries: Chad, Cameroon, Niger, and the Central African Republic, to attend the meeting. Also invited is the President of the Republic of Benin, which also contributes troops to the MNJTF.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The objective of the one-day meeting is to review the security situation in areas affected by the Boko Haram insurgency, as well as adopt measures to enhance the capacity of the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) to secure the region.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In my capacity as Chairman of the Summit of Heads of State and Government of the Lake Chad Basin Commission (LCBC), I am convening a consultation of Heads of State and Government of the LCBC, for November 29, 2018, in N’Djamena, Chad.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari approves Enhanced Salary Structure for Nigeria Police Force @PoliceNG.
retweet_text: President @MBuhari approves Enhanced Salary Structure for Nigeria Police Force @PoliceNG.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The court should always be the last resort for the dissatisfied. For the party to outlaw the court process is not acceptable to me.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We cannot deliberately deny people of their rights. We agreed that party primaries should be conducted either through direct, indirect or consensus methods, and if anyone feels unjustly treated in the process, such a person can go to court.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I disagree with the position of our party forbidding aggrieved members from taking the party to court, and threatening to penalize those who do.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In spite of the long delay in the passage of the 2018 budget, and in the approval of the budget’s Borrowing Plan, we will continue to demonstrate our commitment to infrastructure development. Developing infrastructure is one of the best things any Government can do for Nigerians.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We must resist the temptation to play politics with the tragedy of the deaths of our soldiers. They are heroes on the frontlines,fighting to make Nigeria a safer place for us all. Rest assured that the circumstances that have led to these deaths will be comprehensively addressed.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The military & intelligence agencies have worked hard in the fight against terrorism,and I am once again pledging, as Commander-in-Chief, my full support as they push to totally neutralize Boko Haram. May the souls of the dead rest in peace. Their sacrifice will NEVER be in vain. https://t.co/zI4eohqNjl

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Happy Birthday to former President Dr. @GEJonathan. I join millions of Nigerians in sending warm greetings to him as he turns 61 today. I pray that the Almighty God will grant him long life and good health, and continue to bless him and his family.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As I always say, we have no other country but Nigeria. Let us not set it ablaze because of politics or sectional interests.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It is also very important to emphasize this: that even as the Presidential and National Assembly campaigns kick off, all candidates and the supporters of all political parties owe it a duty to themselves and to our dear country to go about the campaigns peacefully and decently.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are committed to deepening the work we started in this first term,such that Nigeria’s assets and resources continue to be organized & utilized for the good of the common man. Join @ProfOsinbajo and I on this journey to the NEXT LEVEL of a prosperous, strong and stable Nigeria! https://t.co/AnMu3pvEK4

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The next four years will be quite significant for Nigeria. We are now faced with a choice: To keep on building a new Nigeria or to go back to its tainted past which favoured only an opportunistic few. https://t.co/ZD3UCAExTb

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations to the Super Eagles on their qualification for the 2019 Africa Cup of Nations. Their confidence, patriotism and professionalism have inspired us all. Also grateful to the coaching crew, the Nigeria Football Federation, and the Supporters Club for their hard work.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: One of the Bills I signed into law last week is for an Act establishing the Nigeria Center for Disease Control (NCDC). The Agency has existed for seven years, without enabling legislation. Now @NCDCgov has an Act, and is further empowered to deliver on its very important mandate. https://t.co/m8VetyJyOi

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The welfare of workers will continue to be our priority. I thank the leadership of the organized labour and private sector, and representatives of State and Federal Govts, for all their hard work. That we’re now here at this stage of the review process, is a notable achievement.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I ask for patience and understanding from everyone in the coming weeks, as we commence a review of the Minimum Wage Report. Our plan is to transmit an Executive Bill to the National Assembly for passage within the shortest possible time.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We recognize the validity of both sides of the debate: On the government side, the concerns around affordability, considering that even today many states struggle to meet existing salary obligations. And on the side of labour, there is the need for any increase to be meaningful.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It is truly inspiring is that, in all of this, the members of the Committee always came back to the negotiating table with a common goal of improving the welfare of Nigerian workers.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: From the onset, we knew the committee had a difficult task ahead of it; that there would be heated debates and strong differences, on the way to a consensus position acceptable by all parties.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: A year ago, on November 27, 2017, I inaugurated the National Minimum Wage Committee,with a mandate to recommend a new minimum wage for Nigerian workers. I am pleased that they have now completed their work,and submitted the Report. The entire nation is grateful for their service. https://t.co/vjg8yxfbcb

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We remain focused on the 3 fundamental issues that we campaigned on: security, the economy and the fight against corruption. And will make up for the lost opportunities of the past, when we should have used our resources to focus on our transport, power and social infrastructure.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The late General Shehu Musa Yar’Adua was my classmate. We spent close to nine years in boarding school, at primary and secondary levels. And from there, after our WASC, we moved to join the Army, where we had to take a military examination as one of the requirements.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As a Nigerian military officer, it would have been impossible for me to have attended the Defence Services Staff College in India in 1973, and, after that - in 1979 - the United States Army War College, had I not sat for the WASC examinations, which I did in 1961. https://t.co/pqTGMpcyC2

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I received the attestation and confirmation of my 1961 West African School Certificate (WASC) Examination result, from the Registrar of the West African Examinations Council (WAEC). It was also an opportunity for me to thank WAEC for upholding its integrity over the years. https://t.co/coJpMFZ0Kr

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Federal Government will also continue to work to ensure that more security assets are recruited and deployed across the country to protect all citizens going about their lawful business, and to reinforce the authority of the government.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I commend the efforts of the Kaduna State Government in responding to and managing the crisis. They have set an example of responsiveness that should be emulated across the country. The Federal Government will continue to support them with adequate Federal security assets.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My condolences to the Government and people of Kaduna State, and to the families who lost loved ones to the violence. Condolences also to the family and people of the late Agom Adara, Dr. Maiwada Galadima. He served his community with dedication; may his soul rest in peace.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I appeal to community and religious leaders to do everything in their power to uphold peace in their communities, and to refrain from shielding the perpetrators of violence from law enforcement agencies. Violence is never the solution.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: There are no circumstances in which these killings are acceptable or justifiable.I expect the Police to remain vigilant in securing communities, & also diligent in prosecuting perpetrators. They must make the work of the Judiciary easier;there’s no room for shoddy investigations.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari is currently in Kaduna to meet with communities affected by the recent violence in the State. #AsoVill…
retweet_text: President @MBuhari is currently in Kaduna to meet with communities affected by the recent violence in the State. #AsoVillaToday https://t.co/NDJdvLhejJ

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I paid a visit to Kaduna to sympathize with the people on the recent killings and unrest in the State, and to meet with the affected communities. Our security agencies are now on top of the situation, and we shall ensure that all the perpetrators are held to account.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigerians will enjoy free and fair elections in 2019. The President has only one vote, governors have a vote each, just like anybody else. Let the people vote for whoever they choose, without their will being tampered with. The era of awarding votes is well and truly behind us.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @ProfOsinbajo: This morning, you can join me on Radio Berekete at 101.1MHz as I discuss pertinent issues with the Ordinary President.

Y…
retweet_text:
This morning, you can join me on Radio Berekete at 101.1MHz as I discuss pertinent issues with the Ordinary President.

You can watch here 👇🏽 if you are not in Abuja.

https://t.co/LSImmZmMGY

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our focus is on infrastructure; roads, rail, power, etc. I wish we had fixed all those when we had money. What we earned between 1999 and 2014 is on record,but nothing was done to infrastructure. Now, we are doing a lot more, with a lot less. And we shall continue to do our best. https://t.co/3Wmg8vdU1Z

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari received a delegation from the National Association of Nigerian Traders. “For the first time in the hi…
retweet_text: President @MBuhari received a delegation from the National Association of Nigerian Traders. “For the first time in the history of governments and governance in this country, this administration remembered traders... @Trader_Moni has a lot of significance for poverty reduction.” https://t.co/97O90XXUHG

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I pray that the Almighty God will grant his soul eternal rest, and comfort his family, friends, political associates and all who mourn him.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Chief Anenih was for decades a frontline figure on Nigeria’s political landscape: State Chairman of the National Party of Nigeria (NPN), National Chairman of the Social Democratic Party (SDP), chieftain of the PDP, and a former Minister of Works.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My heartfelt condolences to the Anenih family on the death of its beloved patriarch and elder statesman, Chief Anthony Anenih. Condolences also to the government and people of Edo State, and the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), where he was a former Chairman, Board of Trustees.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Dr Stella Adadevoh would have turned 62 today. Today and always we celebrate her dedication and sacrifice. As part of our efforts to build on her legacy our administration has put great effort into strengthening the Nigeria Center for Disease Control (NCDC).

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In security, the people of the Northeast are in the best position to comment on the gains we have made in the fight against terrorism. They lost local LGAs Boko Haram, schools and roads were closed, commercial flights halted, and religious festivals observed in fear and terror.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are connecting every part of Nigeria by standard-gauge rail. We‘re upgrading roads, highways,airports around the country. Our efforts in Power generation, transmission, distribution are yielding fruit. All of these are in fulfillment of our promise to invest in infrastructure.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In every zone of the country, our administration has infrastructure projects ongoing: roads,rail, housing, power,health. We‘re very serious about investing in the building blocks of a prosperous nation. We‘re also committed to keeping our promise to complete all stalled projects. https://t.co/kFaQr2GMlr

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
Today I commissioned the new International Terminal of the Port Harcourt Airport. A significant landmark for International air travellers, not just from the South South region, but also the entire Country. 
We will continue to upgrade Nigeria’s transport and power infrastructure. https://t.co/lFMhI2Dneg

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: “President @MBuhari's commitment to Nigeria is that he will not steal Nigeria's resources; he will use Nigeria's money fo…
retweet_text: “President @MBuhari's commitment to Nigeria is that he will not steal Nigeria's resources; he will use Nigeria's money for the benefit of Nigerians. That is the pledge he made the day he became President and he has maintained that pledge till now.”— VP @ProfOsinbajo

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: For a long time Nigeria’s wealth was used to benefit only a greedy minority. Years of high oil revenues failed to translate into improvements in infrastructure or quality of living. Our administration was elected to break free from that past; we will be steadfast in this mission.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our intention in this administration is simple and clear: we will fix Nigeria’s infrastructure; we will improve the lives and living conditions of the poor, through our emphasis on agriculture and social investment. We will invest in the people of Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I believe that if we fix infrastructure- roads, rail, power - a lot of Nigerians will mind their own business and be energized to pursue their dreams. I don’t know why previous administrations since 1999 did not use their foresight to focus on infrastructure and get it right.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I thank everyone who came tonight. I will never take your support for granted. Together we will build a Nigeria we can all be proud of; a land that our children and grandchildren will be proud to call their own. The journey has started, and we will work together to complete it. https://t.co/kiZzz3Qk7H

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I spent the evening at dinner with a group of young supporters of our administration and our party, the All Progressives Congress (APC). All of them united by their love for Nigeria and their desire and determination to see the country thrive and prosper, today and in the future. https://t.co/nN3tW64UUR

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My Speech at the Inauguration Ceremony: https://t.co/cSDs8dBW5b https://t.co/CdyU87CN5t

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We take our relationships with our neighbours very seriously. Nigeria and Benin indeed share many things in common; and I would like to congratulate my brother, President Patrice Talon of the Republic of Benin, on the successful completion of this very important project. https://t.co/kHscNgVSKd

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: President Patrice Talon of the Republic of Benin & I today jointly inaugurated the upgraded Border Post at the SÈMÈ-KRAKÉ Joint Border, one of the busiest boundary lines in Africa. The new Border Post is a symbol of integration that brings together the peoples of Nigeria & Benin. https://t.co/DE0Hrf6ceg

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We cannot go back to the days of signing agreements without understanding and planning for the consequences of such actions. The Committee has a 12-week mandate to produce a clear roadmap for Nigeria as it relates to the AfCFTA. https://t.co/2IcXDhSPXA

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today in Abuja I inaugurated a Committee to address the various issues raised during the nationwide stakeholder consultations on the African Continental Free Trade Area Agreement (AfCFTA). Read my full speech at the Inauguration: https://t.co/mnlRp4aE1d https://t.co/O1hR82p3Xq

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me also commend the Kaduna State government for its rapid response to the crisis. The Federal Government and its law enforcement agencies will work with the State Government and community leaders to ensure the full restoration of peace and security.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The disregard for the sanctity of human life is unacceptable. Violence is an ill-wind that blows nobody any good. I appeal to community leaders and citizens to always choose dialogue, patience and tolerance, to prevent crises from escalating into violence.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The violence in Kaduna, which has resulted in the deaths of 55 innocent people, is condemnable. The Police have been authorized to do everything possible to restore calm. A Special Intervention Force has been deployed to the flash-points, and the IG will provide regular updates.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am reassuring everyone that the Fed Govt will continue to do all within our power to protect not just humanitarian workers, but also everyone working or living in the North East. I salute our military, who continue to fight and strive hard to permanently neutralize Boko Haram.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We fervently hope that these series of sad events, leading to the painful loss of their staff, will not discourage the ICRC from working in Nigeria. We hope that they will continue to offer their services, and not give up, inspite of what has happened.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I also spoke with @PMaurerICRC, the President of the ICRC, to extend our condolences on the death of Hauwa. The ICRC has been doing a great job in Nigeria, providing healthcare services to people in the areas most affected by the insurgency. We salute their courage and service.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Hauwa dedicated herself to serving the victims of Boko Haram’s insurgency, and it is extremely sad that her life ended the way it did, at the hands of the terrorists. I expressed our deepest condolences to her father, on behalf of the Government and all the people of Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I spoke with Mohammed Liman, father of Hauwa, the ICRC midwife killed by Boko Haram. It is not the kind of telephone call anyone prays to make. The Federal Govt did everything possible to save Hauwa’s life; it is tragic & regrettable that all our efforts were unsuccessful.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari: “We did not introduce [the Treasury Single Account, TSA], but we enforced it. TSA makes a lot of sens…
retweet_text: President @MBuhari: “We did not introduce [the Treasury Single Account, TSA], but we enforced it. TSA makes a lot of sense that you must have to give account for whatever comes in and goes out in government finance; that’s accountability.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari, during his meeting with ANAN Executives yesterday: 

“One of the cardinal objectives of this administ…
retweet_text:
President @MBuhari, during his meeting with ANAN Executives yesterday: 

“One of the cardinal objectives of this administration is that people and all government institutions must give account for what comes in and goes out. We did not introduce TSA, but we enforced it.” https://t.co/8cIhoTsY6W

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me also express my personal appreciation to the Archbishop of Canterbury, the Most Reverend Justin Welby, who in spite of his busy schedule accepted to be the keynote speaker at this important conference. https://t.co/jBCrB0yi9U

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I sincerely hope 2019 will move us closer to these goals and so I look forward to peaceful, fair and credible elections come 2019. https://t.co/bPEHXBKkTK

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am proud to say that our country has moved on, the era of free money, lack of transparency and accountability is over! We deserve continuity; we deserve a better future for the coming generations.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: To all of us politicians, I ask that we discharge our political responsibilities with integrity, bearing in mind that we will one day give an account to God, the Almighty.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As your President, I will request that you encourage your subjects to come out and exercise their voting rights as responsible citizens.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On their part, traditional rulers are also requested to enlighten their subjects, encourage them to ask questions and seek clarifications before going out to vote.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Religious leaders should not be seen to involve themselves in partisan politics or political controversies. Otherwise they risk losing their status and public respect.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Having witnessed the roles our religious leaders have been playing so far, I appeal to them to eschew partisan politics and appeal to their respective members to read the manifestos of each political party, discuss, and pray for God’s guidance before casting their votes.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Very soon, political campaigns will commence leading to Elections in February. It is my hope and prayer that we will even perform better at the polling stations and see to a peaceful completion of the entire process without resorting to the negative use of religion and ethnicity.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our Primary Elections are over, it is my hope that all who feel aggrieved would put the stability of Nigeria first, before their political ambitions, and accept the decision of their political parties or seek resolution through party reconciliation mechanisms or the law courts.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: His Eminence John Cardinal Onaiyekan, the Catholic Archbishop of Abuja and His Eminence Alh. Muhammad Sa’ad Abubakar, the Sultan of Sokoto are the Co-Initiators of this Initiative, which has continued to work for peace and peaceful coexistence between Muslims and Christians. https://t.co/8Jppr1MdZk

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today in Abuja I addressed a Conference by the Interfaith Initiative for Peace, with the theme, “Religious Harmony in Nigeria: Towards the 2019 General Election.” The full text of my speech: https://t.co/Rl3MUZcQKe https://t.co/q6DfmJdpkq

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Defaulting taxpayers who fail to take advantage of VOARS will, at the expiration of the scheme, be subject to investigation and enforcement procedures. With the Automatic Exchange of Information between Nigeria and foreign countries, there will be no hiding place for anyone.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Office of the Attorney-General and Minister of Justice has been mandated to set up a VOARS in Switzerland for all categories of taxpayers who have defaulted in the declaration of offshore assets and payment of due taxes.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are stepping up the fight against corruption, targeting money laundering and tax evasion. The new Executive Order takes effect from Monday, October 8, 2018.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have signed a new Executive Order (EO 008), the Voluntary Offshore Assets Regularization Scheme (VOARS), mandating Nigerian taxpayers who hold offshore assets and incomes to, within a period of 12 months, voluntarily declare those assets and pay taxes on them.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @NGRPresident: #ICYMI: #AsoVillaWeekly

#NigeriaAt58

President @MBuhari spoke with Leah Sharibu’s mum; welcomed Pastor WF Kumuyi to Sta…
retweet_text:
#ICYMI: #AsoVillaWeekly

#NigeriaAt58

President @MBuhari spoke with Leah Sharibu’s mum; welcomed Pastor WF Kumuyi to State House

VP @ProfOsinbajo launched MSME Clinics @msmeclinicsng in Enugu and Kaduna; chaired meeting of NEC Steering Committee on Human Capital Development https://t.co/83hVDiHblA

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: These very talented young men and women, Xplicit Dancers, entertained us last night at the APC National Convention. This morning I hosted them to breakfast at the State House. I‘m impressed by the way they are combining their immense creative talent with the pursuit of education. https://t.co/CVgHICiPkv

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @OfficialAPCNg: #APCNationalConvention: Its official. With 14, 842, 072 million votes from party members during the nationwide president…
retweet_text: #APCNationalConvention: Its official. With 14, 842, 072 million votes from party members during the nationwide presidential direct primaries, @NGRPresident @MBuhari is the candidate of our great party for the #2019Elections. https://t.co/5COqz5H9gL

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Full Text of my Acceptance Speech as Candidate and Flagbearer of our great Party, the All Progressives Congress (APC), in the 2019 Presidential Election: https://t.co/wxHykePyv5 https://t.co/nRQNpVNGtH

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let us all join hands to ensure the continuation of the good work of the APC Government, to 2023 — and beyond! Change has come to stay in Nigeria. Long live APC, long live the Federal Republic of Nigeria! https://t.co/hPYKtgBx32

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It is with a deep sense of humility that I accept the nomination of our great party, the All Progressives Congress, to be its candidate and flagbearer in the 2019 Presidential election. I thank you all for your support and guidance, and for staying committed to the Change Agenda.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @ProfOsinbajo: The Federal Government, through the Corporate Affairs Commission @cacnigeria1  has approved a special window of 90 days f…
retweet_text: The Federal Government, through the Corporate Affairs Commission @cacnigeria1  has approved a special window of 90 days from Oct. 1 to Dec. 31 to register businesses at a considerably reduced rate of N5,000. https://t.co/5C5mo59YBy

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me reiterate that fighting  corruption is non-negotiable for our administration. It is one of the reasons we got elected, and we cannot afford to let Nigerians down. When we tackle corruption we free up resources for investment in infrastructure and development.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I met with former South African President Thabo Mbeki today, in his capacity as Head of the AU High Level Panel on Illicit Financial Flows from Africa. Nigeria is pleased with what he is accomplishing for the continent,and we will continue to fully support him in this assignment. https://t.co/AGpXUJdke7

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I spoke with Mrs Rebecca Sharibu, to reiterate our determination to bring her daughter Leah back home safely. The thoughts & prayers of all Nigerians are with the Sharibu family, & the families of all those still in captivity. We will do everything we can to bring them back

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me also make it clear that we will not tolerate lawlessness and anarchy in Plateau or anywhere else in Nigeria. The seeming indifference to the sanctity of life is very worrying, and will be met with the full force of the law.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The peace achieved in recent years by the people of Plateau must not be squandered. Where there are differences, dialogue should be seen as the only solution. Through past efforts of the State Govt and local communities we have seen that peace and dialogue are indeed possible.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I thanked Pastor Kumuyi for accepting the government’s invitation to preach the sermon at the Church service to mark Nigeria’s 58th Independence anniversary. His acceptance, and visit to me today, are both greatly appreciated. https://t.co/Vlp7Pjptzn

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari today hosted the General Superintendent of Deeper Life Bible Church, Pastor W.F. Kumuyi, and his wife,…
retweet_text: President @MBuhari today hosted the General Superintendent of Deeper Life Bible Church, Pastor W.F. Kumuyi, and his wife, Pastor Mrs Esther Kumuyi, at the State House. #AsoVillaToday https://t.co/JQuV0n9V0d

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I was very pleased to welcome Pastor W. F. Kumuyi, founder and General Superintendent of the Deeper Life Bible Church, and his wife, to the State House today. https://t.co/Z7rcAEKvFV

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @ProfOsinbajo: Happy Independence Day Nigeria.

You will prevail. https://t.co/YfvHxt3ljW
retweet_text:
Happy Independence Day Nigeria.

You will prevail. https://t.co/YfvHxt3ljW

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
We have so much for which we should be grateful as a nation, and in which we should rightly take pride. Our journey is not finished but we have come a long way.

Full Text of my Independence Day Address: https://t.co/R5bBCdPK8R
#NigeriaAt58

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
As we celebrate the 58th Anniversary of our Independence, we know we are on the right path. Although we have our differences, they count for far less than the values, virtues and common aspirations that unite us as a nation. #NigeriaAt58 
https://t.co/R5bBCdPK8R

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I visited Squadron Leader Batuba & Flight Lieutenant Andy,the two survivors of the tragic collision of 2 Nigerian Air Force fighter jets on Friday in Abuja. I pray for their quick recovery,and also for the family of Squadron Leader Babari, who lost his life in the incident. https://t.co/QYk61wjKye

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The plight of Nigerian traders in Ghana came up when I met with President @NAkufoAddo yesterday. He assured me that Nigerians are not being deliberately targeted. The relationship between our countries is a very important one, and will not be taken for granted by either side. https://t.co/L78t7nqLQT

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @NGRPresident: Bilateral Meetings held by President @MBuhari this week, on the sidelines of #UNGA: 

- President @CyrilRamaphosa of Sout…
retweet_text:
Bilateral Meetings held by President @MBuhari this week, on the sidelines of #UNGA: 

- President @CyrilRamaphosa of South Africa
- UN Secretary General @antonioguterres 
- President @NAkufoAddo of Ghana
- OIC Secretary General, Dr Yousef Ahmed Al-Othaimeen 

#PMBAtUNGA18 🇳🇬 https://t.co/CBHfsX5JbE

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I also commend the maturity, loyalty and courage of all the contestants. Everyone put in their best to be elected to serve Osun State. I urge all those who disagree with the outcome to take advantage of the judicial process and seek redress in court.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I charge the Governor-elect to always remember that the people of Osun State expect complete dedication and commitment to governance that will improve their lives and build on the legacy of the outgoing Governor, Ogbeni Rauf Aregbesola.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I congratulate the All Progressives Congress (APC) and the Governor-Elect of Osun State, Adegboyega Isiaka Oyetola. Thank you Osun State for supporting our good governance agenda by re-electing the APC. We will continue to work for you, and for the entire country. https://t.co/s245mzxkmZ

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations to our women basketball team, D'Tigress, who today won their second game in the ongoing FIBA Women’s World Cup. We are proud of you, and of what you have accomplished so far.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My address at the General Debate of the 73rd UNGA Session, today in New York: https://t.co/obcG0VO9BC https://t.co/zzQcipc8rj

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: I thank you all for your attention. //
retweet_text: I thank you all for your attention. //

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: ... will readily cooperate with other nations seeking to achieve similar goals for their own populations to help ensure t…
retweet_text: ... will readily cooperate with other nations seeking to achieve similar goals for their own populations to help ensure that no one is left behind.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Without these, there can be neither enduring peace nor security. As we set and implement our national policies to achieve…
retweet_text: Without these, there can be neither enduring peace nor security. As we set and implement our national policies to achieve these goals, we, in the spirit of international solidarity, ...

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: We are resolute in complementing the efforts and examples of the United Nations to promote gender equality and youth empo…
retweet_text: We are resolute in complementing the efforts and examples of the United Nations to promote gender equality and youth empowerment as necessary pillars for sustainable development.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Furthermore, Nigeria has always mobilised the required human and material resources to achieve set United Nations goals,…
retweet_text: Furthermore, Nigeria has always mobilised the required human and material resources to achieve set United Nations goals, including the recently adopted 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: We have been active participants in many Security Council and African Union authorised Peace Keeping operations around th…
retweet_text: We have been active participants in many Security Council and African Union authorised Peace Keeping operations around the world, beginning with the Democratic Republic of Congo operations in 1960.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: I assure you all that in this advocacy, I am only reflecting Nigeria’s deep and abiding commitment to our Organisation an…
retweet_text: I assure you all that in this advocacy, I am only reflecting Nigeria’s deep and abiding commitment to our Organisation and its founding principles and goals. From the date we joined in 1960, we have contributed our quota to the fulfilment of the mandate of the UN.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: It is high time we stopped skirting round the issue and established achievable benchmarks and time frames for these refor…
retweet_text: It is high time we stopped skirting round the issue and established achievable benchmarks and time frames for these reforms.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: We believe that a reformed Security Council with expanded membership in both the permanent and non-permanent categories,…
retweet_text: We believe that a reformed Security Council with expanded membership in both the permanent and non-permanent categories, is in accord with prevailing international consensus and it is in our collective interest to do so.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The reconstitution of the Security Council to make it more equitable and more representative of our global community is b…
retweet_text: The reconstitution of the Security Council to make it more equitable and more representative of our global community is both a political and moral imperative.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: That is why we continue to call for the strengthening of the Organisation and making it more effective by speeding up the…
retweet_text: That is why we continue to call for the strengthening of the Organisation and making it more effective by speeding up the pace of progress towards its reform, including that of its principal organ, the Security Council.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The only global institutional framework we have to address these challenges is the United Nations System.
retweet_text: The only global institutional framework we have to address these challenges is the United Nations System.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: ... and the many other global challenges we are faced with today can only be effectively addressed through multilateral c…
retweet_text: ... and the many other global challenges we are faced with today can only be effectively addressed through multilateral cooperation and concerted action.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Fighting corruption or resolving Int’l conflicts, crises and wars; defeating terrorism & piracy; curbing arms trafficking…
retweet_text: Fighting corruption or resolving Int’l conflicts, crises and wars; defeating terrorism & piracy; curbing arms trafficking & proliferation of small arms & light weapons which fuel these conflicts, particularly in Africa; stemming irregular migration by addressing its root causes;

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The fight against corruption, therefore, involves us all. It is in our collective interest to cooperate in tracking illic…
retweet_text: The fight against corruption, therefore, involves us all. It is in our collective interest to cooperate in tracking illicit financial flows, investigate and prosecute corrupt individuals and entities and repatriate such funds to their countries of origin.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Corruption significantly deprives national Governments of resources to provide meaningful livelihoods to their population…
retweet_text: Corruption significantly deprives national Governments of resources to provide meaningful livelihoods to their populations who are predominantly youths, thus giving rise to more irregular migration.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Madam President, Corruption within countries and illicit flow of funds across national boundaries have huge negative impa…
retweet_text: Madam President, Corruption within countries and illicit flow of funds across national boundaries have huge negative impact on the stability, peace, and economic prospects of millions in developing countries.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: ... and a host of other development partners for their laudable support in assisting us to address both the humanitarian…
retweet_text: ... and a host of other development partners for their laudable support in assisting us to address both the humanitarian challenges and the on-going stabilisation drive in the region.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: With regard to the Lake Chad Basin plight, I extend our heartfelt appreciation to the United Nations, the Governments of…
retweet_text: With regard to the Lake Chad Basin plight, I extend our heartfelt appreciation to the United Nations, the Governments of Germany, Norway, the United States, Sweden, the United Kingdom, France...

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: What is required is continuous and robust UN cooperation with national Governments and sub-regional and regional organisa…
retweet_text: What is required is continuous and robust UN cooperation with national Governments and sub-regional and regional organisations such as the Lake Chad Basin Commission, ECOWAS and the African Union, to enhance capacity in conflict prevention, conflict management and peace building.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: This is why we continue to call for a rededicated international engagement to accelerate the recovery efforts in the Lake…
retweet_text: This is why we continue to call for a rededicated international engagement to accelerate the recovery efforts in the Lake Chad Basin to address the root causes of the conflicts in the region.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The instability thus caused in the sub-region intensified internal displacements leading, among other consequences, to in…
retweet_text: The instability thus caused in the sub-region intensified internal displacements leading, among other consequences, to intense economic competition especially between farmers and herdsmen.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The Lake was a major source of livelihood to more than 45 million inhabitants of the region. Its shrinking meant loss of…
retweet_text: The Lake was a major source of livelihood to more than 45 million inhabitants of the region. Its shrinking meant loss of livelihoods and they are now rendered poor and vulnerable to the activities of extremists and terrorist groups.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Very close to us at home, it is our lot in Nigeria, together with our neighbours around the Chad Basin, to live with the…
retweet_text: Very close to us at home, it is our lot in Nigeria, together with our neighbours around the Chad Basin, to live with the Climate change consequences of a drastically shrunk Lake Chad and the parching up of otherwise fertile arable lands.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Climate Change remains one of the greatest challenges of our time.
retweet_text: Climate Change remains one of the greatest challenges of our time.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Irregular migration is not a consequence of conflicts alone, but of the effects of climate change and lack of opportuniti…
retweet_text: Irregular migration is not a consequence of conflicts alone, but of the effects of climate change and lack of opportunities at home.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Migration is a constant in human affairs. We in Africa are grateful to countries who treat migrants with compassion and h…
retweet_text: Migration is a constant in human affairs. We in Africa are grateful to countries who treat migrants with compassion and humanity — notably Germany, Italy and France.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The aim is to protect the rights of migrants worldwide, while addressing the concerns of countries of ‘origin’, ‘transit’…
retweet_text: The aim is to protect the rights of migrants worldwide, while addressing the concerns of countries of ‘origin’, ‘transit’, or ‘destination’ alike.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: That is why we welcome the successful conclusion of the negotiations on the first-ever Global Compact for Safe, Orderly a…
retweet_text: That is why we welcome the successful conclusion of the negotiations on the first-ever Global Compact for Safe, Orderly and Regular Migration, and we look forward to its adoption in Marrakech later this year.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Irregular migration entails huge avoidable loss of human lives, puts strains on services in host countries and communitie…
retweet_text: Irregular migration entails huge avoidable loss of human lives, puts strains on services in host countries and communities, and fuels anti- immigrant and racist sentiments in Europe.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Madam President, A topical consequence of the current conflicts around the world is the irregular migration of affected p…
retweet_text: Madam President, A topical consequence of the current conflicts around the world is the irregular migration of affected people from the Middle East, Afghanistan, and Africa, to Europe.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Hence, ‘Making the United Nations relevant to all people: Global Leadership and Shared Responsibilities for Peaceful, Equ…
retweet_text: Hence, ‘Making the United Nations relevant to all people: Global Leadership and Shared Responsibilities for Peaceful, Equitable and sustainable Societies’ which is the theme for this year’s General Assembly, is very apt indeed.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Most crises usually have a variety of festering causes and effects. It is the failure to address them early and effective…
retweet_text: Most crises usually have a variety of festering causes and effects. It is the failure to address them early and effectively that lead to out- of- control conflicts. Addressing them includes national & Int’l collective actions which positively impact on peoples and communities.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: I believe that with hard work, commitment, and a disposition to compromise and necessary sacrifices, peace is achievable…
retweet_text: I believe that with hard work, commitment, and a disposition to compromise and necessary sacrifices, peace is achievable in the Middle East as well.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: We should draw inspiration from the remarkable leadership that got Ethiopia & Eritrea to restore long-lost hope for peace…
retweet_text: We should draw inspiration from the remarkable leadership that got Ethiopia & Eritrea to restore long-lost hope for peace between them,a remarkable show of statesmanship which has now galvanised neighbouring countries, incl. Djibouti & Somalia to push for peace in the subregion.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The crises in the Middle East have deep roots and have remained unresolved for too long. Yet, we should not fall into sel…
retweet_text: The crises in the Middle East have deep roots and have remained unresolved for too long. Yet, we should not fall into self-defeating despair and conclude that they are not amenable to solution.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Nigeria reaffirms its unwavering support for a just two-state solution, negotiated without intimidation and with Israel a…
retweet_text: Nigeria reaffirms its unwavering support for a just two-state solution, negotiated without intimidation and with Israel and Palestine existing side-by-side in peace and security.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: We urge both parties to re-engage in dialogue on the basis of relevant UN resolutions, the Madrid Principles, the Quartet…
retweet_text: We urge both parties to re-engage in dialogue on the basis of relevant UN resolutions, the Madrid Principles, the Quartet Roadmap and the Arab Peace Initiative, among others.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Unilateral, arbitrary and insensitive actions only prolong the conflict and undermine world peace and security. The deter…
retweet_text: Unilateral, arbitrary and insensitive actions only prolong the conflict and undermine world peace and security. The deteriorating humanitarian situation in Gaza is an appalling result of unrestrained use of power.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Nigeria continues to call on the Israelis and the Palestinians to make the necessary compromises in the interest of justi…
retweet_text: Nigeria continues to call on the Israelis and the Palestinians to make the necessary compromises in the interest of justice, peace and security, in line with our numerous UN resolutions and applicable international laws.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The situation in the Middle East, grave as it has always been, is now worsened by developments since our last meeting.
retweet_text: The situation in the Middle East, grave as it has always been, is now worsened by developments since our last meeting.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: We commend Turkey, Jordan, Greece, Germany, Italy and France for hosting the millions of the refugees fleeing these bruta…
retweet_text: We commend Turkey, Jordan, Greece, Germany, Italy and France for hosting the millions of the refugees fleeing these brutal conflicts.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The International community must keep up the pressure to encourage the parties to pursue the path of dialogue, negotiatio…
retweet_text: The International community must keep up the pressure to encourage the parties to pursue the path of dialogue, negotiations and inclusiveness in resolving their sectarian divides and bringing to an end the immense human suffering in Syria as well as Yemen.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: We must pursue all efforts to find peaceful negotiated political solutions to these wars which cannot be won by force of…
retweet_text: We must pursue all efforts to find peaceful negotiated political solutions to these wars which cannot be won by force of arms alone. Regarding Syria, we hope that the UN sponsored Geneva process and the Sochi initiative, led by Russia, Iran, and Turkey advance this objective.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The carnage and the worsening humanitarian situations in Syria and Yemen continue unabated. But the international communi…
retweet_text: The carnage and the worsening humanitarian situations in Syria and Yemen continue unabated. But the international community cannot afford to give up on the Syrian and Yemeni people.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: In this context, Nigeria commends the Government and people of Bangladesh in particular and all other countries and organ…
retweet_text: In this context, Nigeria commends the Government and people of Bangladesh in particular and all other countries and organizations that have contributed to shouldering the burden of providing shelter and other vital assistance to the Rohingya Refugees.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: We note the indication by the Government of Myanmar of its willingness to address these issues and we encourage them to d…
retweet_text: We note the indication by the Government of Myanmar of its willingness to address these issues and we encourage them to do so expeditiously.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The international community should strengthen its resolve to combat ethnic & religious cleansing everywhere. We support t…
retweet_text: The international community should strengthen its resolve to combat ethnic & religious cleansing everywhere. We support the UN’s efforts in ensuring that the Rohingya refugees are allowed to return to their homes in Myanmar with security, protection, and guarantee of citizenship.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: ... of the atrocious crimes committed against innocent and vulnerable members of this community, including women, childre…
retweet_text: ... of the atrocious crimes committed against innocent and vulnerable members of this community, including women, children and the old.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: In Myanmar, the carnage appears to have thankfully abated somewhat. We commend the United Nations for staying focussed on…
retweet_text: In Myanmar, the carnage appears to have thankfully abated somewhat. We commend the United Nations for staying focussed on the situation of the Rohingya people, to bring their suffering to an end, and hold to account the perpetrators...

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: In Myanmar, the carnage appears to have thankfully abated somewhat. We commend the United Nations for staying focussed on…
retweet_text: In Myanmar, the carnage appears to have thankfully abated somewhat. We commend the United Nations for staying focussed on the situation of the Rohingya people, to bring their suffering to an end, and hold to account the perpetrators...

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The terrorist insurgencies we face, particularly in the Sahel and the Lake Chad Basin, are partly fuelled by local factor…
retweet_text: The terrorist insurgencies we face, particularly in the Sahel and the Lake Chad Basin, are partly fuelled by local factors and dynamics, but now increasingly by the international Jihadi Movement, runaway fighters from Iraq and Syria and arms from the disintegration of Libya.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: In some cases, matters got worse. The continuing plight of the Rohingyas in Myanmar, the protracted Israeli/Palestinian c…
retweet_text: In some cases, matters got worse. The continuing plight of the Rohingyas in Myanmar, the protracted Israeli/Palestinian conflict, the wars in Yemen, and Syria, and the fight against international and local terrorism such as Boko Haram and Al-Shabaab come to mind.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Regrettably, many of the crises and threats to peace and security around the world which we debated last year as we did o…
retweet_text: Regrettably, many of the crises and threats to peace and security around the world which we debated last year as we did over several previous years remain unresolved.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: In this connection, we acknowledge the commitment to peace shown by President Donald Trump and Chairman Kim Jong-Un by in…
retweet_text: In this connection, we acknowledge the commitment to peace shown by President Donald Trump and Chairman Kim Jong-Un by initiating a historic Summit. We urge that they continue this positive engagement.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: We particularly commend the efforts of the leaders of the United States, North Korea, and South Korea, to realise our sha…
retweet_text: We particularly commend the efforts of the leaders of the United States, North Korea, and South Korea, to realise our shared goal of a nuclear-free Korean Peninsula.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Madam President, During the past year, the world saw some positive results and encouraging signs from the bilateral and m…
retweet_text: Madam President, During the past year, the world saw some positive results and encouraging signs from the bilateral and multilateral efforts of the international community to address conflicts, crises and threats to world peace.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: He was a visionary leader who inspired hope even in the face of the most daunting challenges. He devoted his entire life’…
retweet_text: He was a visionary leader who inspired hope even in the face of the most daunting challenges. He devoted his entire life’s career to the UN and the pursuit of its ideals and goals. The world is indeed a better place thanks to his exemplary service. #PMBAtUNGA18

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: He demonstrated, in his calm but determined manner, the virtues of compassion, dedication to the cause of justice, fairne…
retweet_text: He demonstrated, in his calm but determined manner, the virtues of compassion, dedication to the cause of justice, fairness and human rights.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: We in Africa, while mourning the loss of this great son of ours and citizen of the world, take pride in the way he served…
retweet_text: We in Africa, while mourning the loss of this great son of ours and citizen of the world, take pride in the way he served humanity in a truly exemplary manner.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: It is appropriate at this point to remember with deep sadness our late 7th Secretary-General Kofi Annan. Kofi’s significa…
retweet_text: It is appropriate at this point to remember with deep sadness our late 7th Secretary-General Kofi Annan. Kofi’s significant contributions to the work of our Organisation have been acknowledged in the well deserved tributes that poured in from around the world following his death.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: I also salute our distinguished Secretary-General, H.E. Mr. Antonio Guterres, who steered the affairs of the Secretariat…
retweet_text: I also salute our distinguished Secretary-General, H.E. Mr. Antonio Guterres, who steered the affairs of the Secretariat with focused commitment to the collective @UN pursuit of global peace and security, equity and justice, inclusiveness, women’s empowerment and human rights.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: We appreciate the effective leadership he gave the 72nd Assembly with such dedication, commitment, and fairness to all me…
retweet_text: We appreciate the effective leadership he gave the 72nd Assembly with such dedication, commitment, and fairness to all member states.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: As you embark on your assignment, I would like to assure you of Nigeria’s support in no less measure than that which we e…
retweet_text: As you embark on your assignment, I would like to assure you of Nigeria’s support in no less measure than that which we extended to your illustrious predecessor, His Excellency Mr. Miroslav Lajčák.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: On behalf of the Government and people of Nigeria, I congratulate you, Madam President, on your well-deserved election as…
retweet_text: On behalf of the Government and people of Nigeria, I congratulate you, Madam President, on your well-deserved election as President of the 73rd General Assembly.

text:
