text: RT @NGRPresident: Follow #PMBAtUNGA18 and #NigeriaAtUNGA18 this week.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @ProfOsinbajo: For President @MBuhari and I, investing in people will always be a fundamental principle of governance.

Trader Moni prov…
retweet_text:
For President @MBuhari and I, investing in people will always be a fundamental principle of governance.

Trader Moni provides collateral and interest-free loans from 10,000.

No matter who you are and where you come from, investing in you is our priority. https://t.co/jW9e3IFWlp

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My Statement delivered at the Mandela Peace Summit: https://t.co/gVYMJ6ImLC

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I addressed the Peace Summit organized in New York to mark the centenary of Nelson Mandela’s birth. His life symbolised uncommon humility, compassion, courage and forgiveness. We must continue to draw inspiration from his example, and strive to build on his legacy. https://t.co/AYARliixWE

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @GarShehu: The new Director General will announce other appointments into the campaign structure as approved by President Buhari.
retweet_text: The new Director General will announce other appointments into the campaign structure as approved by President Buhari.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @GarShehu: Hon. Amaechi was the Director General of the Buhari-Osinbajo Presidential Campaign Committee in 2014-2015 that won the electi…
retweet_text: Hon. Amaechi was the Director General of the Buhari-Osinbajo Presidential Campaign Committee in 2014-2015 that won the elections and brought the current administration into office.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @GarShehu: President @MBuhari has approved the appointment of a campaign organization for his re-election in 2019 with Hon. @ChibuikeAma…
retweet_text: President @MBuhari has approved the appointment of a campaign organization for his re-election in 2019 with Hon. @ChibuikeAmaechi as Secretary/Director General.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “Osun must remain APC. Osun must continue on the path of progress. Osun must not allow the dark days to return.” #Os…
retweet_text: PMB: “Osun must remain APC. Osun must continue on the path of progress. Osun must not allow the dark days to return.” #OsunDecides2018

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “Nigeria must be free of corrupt and selfish leaders. The children of all Nigerians will get quality infrastructure,…
retweet_text: PMB: “Nigeria must be free of corrupt and selfish leaders. The children of all Nigerians will get quality infrastructure, education, health care and job opportunities. This is why you must all come out and vote for APC on 22nd September 2018.” #OsunDecides2018

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “Nigerians kicked the corrupt and selfish leaders out of the Federal Government in 2015. And by the grace of God, th…
retweet_text: PMB: “Nigerians kicked the corrupt and selfish leaders out of the Federal Government in 2015. And by the grace of God, the voters will continue to keep them out of leadership positions until we permanently consign their corrupt governing style into the history books.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “We will continue to complete old strategic projects. We will also continue to develop and implement new impactful p…
retweet_text: PMB: “We will continue to complete old strategic projects. We will also continue to develop and implement new impactful projects. This is our covenant not only to Osun but to all Nigerians.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “We are also completing some very old roads whose contracts were awarded many years ago. The Ife—Ondo road that was…
retweet_text: PMB: “We are also completing some very old roads whose contracts were awarded many years ago. The Ife—Ondo road that was awarded 12 years ago and the Gbonga—Kwara State road, awarded 9 years ago. These projects & many others will further open up Osun to the rest of the country.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “We‘ve signed the $6.6 billion rail contract for Ibadan—Kaduna rail line. This line will pass through Osogbo thereby…
retweet_text: PMB: “We‘ve signed the $6.6 billion rail contract for Ibadan—Kaduna rail line. This line will pass through Osogbo thereby connecting Osun to not only Ibadan & Lagos but also to Ilorin,Minna & Kaduna. There‘ll also be a single track branch line that will connect Osogbo—Ado-Ekiti.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “We are building transmission lines & sub-stations across the State to improve electricity supply & distribution. We…
retweet_text: PMB: “We are building transmission lines & sub-stations across the State to improve electricity supply & distribution. We have implemented our social investment programs including school feeding & implementation of agricultural projects that have supported thousands of farmers.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “The FG is rehabilitating the Ila-Orangun—Oke Ila—Ilale Akan Road at the sum of N5.19b. We are repairing the Ijebu—I…
retweet_text: PMB: “The FG is rehabilitating the Ila-Orangun—Oke Ila—Ilale Akan Road at the sum of N5.19b. We are repairing the Ijebu—Ijesha road all the way to the Ekiti State Border at the cost of N562.55m. We‘re committed to completing the Gbongan—Iwo road as well as Ojutu Bridge in Ilobu.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “Osun State has empowerment programs to support entrepreneurs. You had school construction & rehabilitation programs…
retweet_text: PMB: “Osun State has empowerment programs to support entrepreneurs. You had school construction & rehabilitation programs to improve the quality of education. You had hygiene,sanitation & health care programs to improve quality of life... security programs that enhanced peace...”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “By electing Oyetola as your Governor, you are guaranteeing the consolidation of these successes.”
retweet_text: PMB: “By electing Oyetola as your Governor, you are guaranteeing the consolidation of these successes.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “You are fully aware of this great partnership story. Oyetola is a partner, a trusted advisor, a brother and a frien…
retweet_text: PMB: “You are fully aware of this great partnership story. Oyetola is a partner, a trusted advisor, a brother and a friend to Governor Aregbesola. They have seamlessly worked together for many years serving you.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “We are also here to pray to Almighty God to safeguard and consolidate on this through Isiaka Gboyega Oyetola.”
retweet_text: PMB: “We are also here to pray to Almighty God to safeguard and consolidate on this through Isiaka Gboyega Oyetola.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “We are here to thank Almighty God for the successful eight-year tenure of the APC Government in [Osun] state under…
retweet_text: PMB: “We are here to thank Almighty God for the successful eight-year tenure of the APC Government in [Osun] state under the leadership of His Excellency, Rauf Aregbesola, the Omoluabi of Yorubaland.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: PMB: “I am always pleased to visit Osun State. The hospitality, the warmth and the friendliness is clear for all to see.…
retweet_text: PMB: “I am always pleased to visit Osun State. The hospitality, the warmth and the friendliness is clear for all to see. Today, we are here to celebrate the past and plan and work for the future.”

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Highlights of President @MBuhari’s Speech at the APC Rally for the Osun State Governorship candidate, Gboyega Oyetola, in…
retweet_text:
Highlights of President @MBuhari’s Speech at the APC Rally for the Osun State Governorship candidate, Gboyega Oyetola, in Oshogbo today: 

#thread

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My sympathies go to all person and communities who have been affected; who have lost loved ones and property to the flooding. NEMA is coordinating the national response to the flooding, and will be actively supported by the military, and other agencies.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Following the declaration of ‘National Disaster’ in the four states most affected by the flooding, I have issued an order directing all Federal government agencies to use their authority and resources to assist the victims. All agencies are expected to take this very seriously.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In the last 3 years the efforts of our gallant military and intelligence agencies have resulted in the  freeing of thousands of hostages, including some of the Chibok Girls and most of the Dapchi Girls. Let me again assure that no one —including Leah Sharibu —will be left behind.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will continue to do everything possible to ensure the safe return of all of our people held by Boko Haram. This is a vow we intend to fully keep. I appeal to our international partners and friends to continue to support us, even as we redouble our efforts.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The killing of Saifura — who worked for the Red Cross, to bring succor to the victims of terrorism — was an act of extreme barbarism; utterly reprehensible and inhuman. The Nigerian Government strongly condemns it.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My deepest condolences to the children and entire family of midwife and humanitarian worker, Saifura Hussaini Ahmed Khorsa. Condolences also to the International Committee of the Red Cross, and UNICEF.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: @MBuhari “On behalf of the President & Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, @MBuhar…
retweet_text:
@MBuhari “On behalf of the President & Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, @MBuhari, I, Engr. Mustapha Maihaja, Director-General of @nemanigeria, hereby declare National Disaster in the following States:
- Kogi
- Niger
- Anambra
- Delta.”

17/09/2018 https://t.co/n8zCOquY55

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In addition, Nigeria’s major inland river channels are being dredged, with adequate channel markings, for ease of navigation through the Eastern and Northern parts of the country.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The same level of serious attention is being given to the improvement of road infrastructure. At the moment, 25 major highways and 44 roads are under construction across the six geopolitical zones of the country.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have directed that every Nigerian port must have the complement of rail infrastructure. Our projection is that by the end of year 2021, we will have a completed standard gauge railway system across the main North-South trading route.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our administration understands the importance of connecting Nigeria’s Ports to the hinterlands, as a condition for improving the country’s economic competitiveness. Our Economic Recovery and Growth Plan fully takes this into account.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This morning in Abuja I addressed the International Association of Ports and Harbours Africa Regional Conference. Nigeria currently holds the Regional Vice Presidency of the Association, through the Managing Director of the Nigerian Ports Authority.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have approved 3 billion Naira for the procurement of medical and relief materials to meet the needs of victims of the flooding. NEMA is also providing me with regular updates on the situation.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Federal Government is closely monitoring the situation along the banks of the Rivers Benue and Niger. I have authorized NEMA to declare a “national disaster” if necessary. The military’s Disaster Response Units will be activated, for search and rescue missions.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We only have one Nigeria. We must not and will not shy away from the responsibility we have to ensure that we hand over a better Nigeria to the next generation. We will continue to work hard to ensure the protection of the livelihoods of all hardworking and honest citizens.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The project is moving smoothly and I have been assured Ariaria market will be fully electrified soon. We are working closely with the State and Local Governments, Traditional Rulers, Market Associations and the community on this project to ensure completion by the end of the year

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I’m pleased to note that in June 2018, the Nigerian Electricity Regulatory Commission granted an electricity generation licence as well as a distribution licence for Ariaria market. This will enable the generation & distribution of 9.5 Megawatts of electricity within the market.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: When we assumed office, we issued a presidential mandate to the Ministry of Power, Works and Housing and the Rural Electrification Agency to energise Ariaria market, as part of our efforts to help unleash its full potential.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Ariaria Market is another priority of our administration. I recall visiting in 2015, as a presidential candidate,and being warmly received. But I also observed the lack of electricity & other basic infrastructure, in a market that is a  major trading hub for West & Central Africa

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am very excited about this project in Aba, and have directed the Minister of Industry, Trade and Investment to ensure the investment is actualised within the shortest possible time. https://t.co/jGEbpwfe4p

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Both the Federal Government and the Abia State Government worked hard jointly on this project, to attract this very important investor. The proposed investment will create thousands of jobs for Aba’s vibrant and creative youths.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Just last week, during my visit to China to attend the Forum for China-Africa Cooperation, I met with executives of one of the largest cotton and garment companies in the world, who will soon establish operations in Aba. https://t.co/UdyPOWwAPk

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I received a delegation of traditional rulers from Abia State, led by His Royal Majesty, Dr. Isaac Ikonne, Enyi 1 of Aba. Our meeting provided an opportunity for me to reiterate our administration’s commitment to the development of the State, and especially the city of Aba. https://t.co/qt2bW1iqjm

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @NGRPresident: PMB (Jan 1, 2018):
"I've approved... Port Harcourt to Maiduguri line (Aba, Owerri, Umuahia, Enugu, Awka, Abakaliki, Makur…
retweet_text:
PMB (Jan 1, 2018):
"I've approved... Port Harcourt to Maiduguri line (Aba, Owerri, Umuahia, Enugu, Awka, Abakaliki, Makurdi, Lafia, Jos, Bauchi, Gombe, Yola, Damaturu). The Abuja-Itakpe line will go through Baro and terminate in Warri with construction of a new seaport at Warri." https://t.co/oT2sd6ldbp

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @NGRPresident: Vice President @ProfOsinbajo is in Ibadan, Oyo State, today, to launch @Trader_Moni. 

#TraderMoni has been launched in t…
retweet_text:
Vice President @ProfOsinbajo is in Ibadan, Oyo State, today, to launch @Trader_Moni. 

#TraderMoni has been launched in the following States:
Lagos, Aug 7
Kano, Aug 18
Abia, Aug 20
Akwa Ibom, Aug 21
Katsina, Sept 1
Osun, Sept 3
FCT, Sept 8
Cross River, Sept 11

Oyo, Sept 13

name: Muhammadu Buhari

retweet_text: President @MBuhari: "These achievements over the past 3 years have not been easy. Corruption has been fighting back from both within and outside. But we have held our ground. And we will continue to serve to the best of our ability, working for the good of all Nigerians."

name: Muhammadu Buhari

retweet_text: President @MBuhari: "Our Economic Recovery and Growth Plan has created the platform for a diversified, sustainable and inclusive economy for future generations."

- feeding children in schools;
- giving micro-credit loans to e…

implementation of the Treasury Sin…

President @MBuhari: "Our fight against corruption is also yielding results. The strict
implementation of the Treasury Single Account has stopped the leakages in government activities. Our aggressive anti-corruption campaign has shown that it is no longer business as usual."

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari: "On food security, we have supported our farmers to produce. We have rehabilitated abandoned fertilis…
retweet_text: President @MBuhari: "On food security, we have supported our farmers to produce. We have rehabilitated abandoned fertiliser plants. We have seen unprecedented investments in food processing. All these have led to a decline in food and other agricultural imports."

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari: "We're completing old rail and road projects and starting new ones; reviving power projects abandoned…
retweet_text: President @MBuhari: "We're completing old rail and road projects and starting new ones; reviving power projects abandoned for decades; developing affordable housing projects across the country; and have commenced the long overdue repairs and upgrades of our sea and air ports."

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We want to ensure that Nigerian students don’t get stranded while pursuing their education abroad, especially on issues that have to do with their visas and documentation.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I told the new Malaysian High Commissioner that I have instructed the Ministers of Education and Foreign Affairs to promptly resolve all issues  affecting Nigerians studying in Malaysia, especially with regards to their visas.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I received Letters of Credence from three new Ambassadors to Nigeria: the High Commissioner of Malaysia to Nigeria, Mrs Gloria Corina Peter Tiwet, Ambassador of the Republic of North Korea, Mr Jon Tong Chol and HC of Trinidad and Tobago, Wendell Vincent Carlton De Landro. https://t.co/LTcvKVFNTp

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
Let me today appeal to party members not to be complacent but to prepare, strategize and win in 2019 elections. 

We must not allow those who brought the country to its knees from 1999 to 2015 to come and take us back. https://t.co/tjFBOM2SAd

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I put my name forward to my party, the All Progressives Congress, seeking nomination to contest the Presidential Elections next year. I assure party members and all Nigerians that, if nominated and if elected, I shall continue to serve you to the best of my ability. https://t.co/3MgdEgHKcW

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have therefore requested that any remaining funds raised to buy my presidential nomination form be used to support these young, competent and dynamic future leaders.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigeria is blessed with many talented and visionary youth who have a lot to contribute. Many of them may not be able to afford the nomination fees set by our party. The contributions of willing individuals & groups will go a long way in supporting the next generation of leaders.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In accepting this nomination form from the NCAN today, I have asked all the other groups who have offered to buy my nomination form to reassign their contributions to the Not Too Young To Run wing of the APC.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We now have a party of strong and patriotic individuals who are ready, willing and able to continue on this journey of building a strong, secure, self-sufficient and corruption-free Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today, I am pleased to say the weakest amongst us, whose selfish expectations did not align with our selfless vision, have exited our party.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: These achievements over the past 3 years have not been easy. Corruption has been fighting back from both within and outside. But we have held our ground.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our economic recovery and growth plan has created the platform for a diversified, sustainable and inclusive economy for future generations.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are also engaging the oil and gas sector to ensure investments continue in the upstream sector while we at the same time reduce scarcity and shortages of products in the downstream sector.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our social investment program is feeding children in schools; giving microcredit loans to entrepreneurs in the rural economy; providing jobs for unemployed graduates; and providing cash to the most vulnerable and poorest Nigerians.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our fight against corruption is also yielding results. The strict implementation of the treasury single account (TSA) has stopped the leakages in government activities. Our aggressive anti-corruption campaign has shown that it is no longer business as usual.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On food security, we have supported our farmers to produce. We have rehabilitated abandoned fertiliser plants. We have seen unprecedented investments in food processing. All these have led to a decline in food and other agricultural imports.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On infrastructure development: we are completing old rail and road projects and starting new ones; reviving power projects abandoned for decades; developing affordable housing projects across the country; & commenced long overdue repairs and upgrades of our sea and air ports

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We have come a long way in 3 years. On the national security front, we have regained lost territory in the North East. We are decisively addressing new security challenges locally while maintaining our regional and international commitments.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Finally, the people’s voices could be heard, and eventually was heard through the ballot box. Our dream for change, which started in 2002, finally became a reality.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Whether it was by design or through divine intervention, the Permanent Voters Card (PVC), was introduced for the 2015 elections. The PVC became the saviour for Nigerians. This meant every Nigerian now had an equal voice, and brought an end to the impunity of the past.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In the 2011 elections, things got a bit better compared to 2007. We only lost by 10 million votes, according to the electoral commission.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Again, we decided to do the right thing. We went to court. And like in 2003, the Supreme Court upheld the results. This time, Nigerians were not deprived of their basic right, it was actually stolen from them right in front of their eyes in broad daylight.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: When the 2007 election results came out, we were told we lost by over 18 million votes. This election was a national disgrace. International observers called it a “charade”, “flawed” and “illegitimate”. Even the declared winners were embarrassed by the results.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We came out once again in 2007 with our simple mission to CHANGE things, since it is our desire that the dividends of democracy must be felt by all, and not just a handful.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In 2002 I joined partisan politics, with a group of like-minded people. We went to work, campaigned hard and formed a credible opposition. Nigerians voted. But when the results came out, we had lost by close to 12 million votes. The statistics did not add up.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My political journey started in 2002, when I emerged from what I like to call my second retirement. My first retirement started in 1985, in a small bungalow in Benin City. My second retirement started in 1999, when the Petroleum Trust Fund (PTF), which I chaired, was disbanded.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Just now at the State House I was presented with the APC Presidential Expression of Interest and Nomination Forms, by the Nigeria Consolidation Ambassadors Network (NCAN). A mixture of familiar faces, as well as new ones,united by a common vision of a secure & prosperous Nigeria. https://t.co/OH0RaQZl1l

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I told President Xi that the Mambilla Hydropower Plant is Nigeria’s equivalent of China’s Three Gorges Dam, and that I look forward to him joining me for the groundbreaking ceremony in the not-too-distant future. I am fully committed to the realization of this landmark project. https://t.co/j5Wc6ufJ04

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Mambilla Hydropower Project remains a key priority for our administration. Today in Beijing I asked for President Xi‘s support and intervention, for the project. Our hope is to fund it with concessionary loans from China. https://t.co/G5ueJplVht

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigeria is fully able to repay all the loans as and when due, in keeping with our policy of fiscal prudence and sound housekeeping.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me use this opportunity to address  and dispel insinuations about a so-called Chinese ‘debt trap’. These vital infrastructure projects being funded are perfectly in line with Nigeria’s Economic Recovery & Growth Plan. Some of the debts, it must be noted, are self-liquidating.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Less than 3 months ago, Nigeria signed an agreement for an additional $1billion loan from China for additional rolling stock for the newly constructed rail lines, as well as road rehabilitation and water supply projects.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigeria is currently leveraging Chinese funding to execute $3.4 billion worth of projects at various stages of completion: upgrading of airport terminals, the Lagos – Kano rail line, Zungeru hydroelectric power project, and fibre cables for our internet infrastructure, and others

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We have completed and flagged off West Africa’s first urban rail system, valued at $500 million, in Abuja. Before then was the 180km rail line that connects Abuja and Kaduna, completed and commissioned in 2016, and running efficiently since then.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am happy to note that Nigeria’s partnership with China through #FOCAC has resulted in the execution of critical infrastructure projects valued at more than $5 billion, over the last three years.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our Meeting also provided an opportunity for me to assure Prime Minister May of my total commitment to conducting free, fair and credible elections in 2019. Nigeria has come to fully accept multiparty democracy, and this is putting politicians on their toes. https://t.co/JqGT5MluhW

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The UK is a very important and strategic country to Nigeria, especially in defence and security, and in trade and investment. Nigeria remains ever grateful for the security assistance we’ve been getting, particularly in training and capacity-building. https://t.co/GwNhSN3DUG

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I was very pleased to welcome Prime Minister May to the State House earlier today. Even as we nervously watch developments regarding Brexit, the United Kingdom is assured of our government’s determination to strengthen the relationship between our two countries. https://t.co/63tiu1zVJC

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I will continue to charge all our security personnel to ensure that they do not spare any cattle rustler, armed robber, kidnapper or any person who thinks he is above the law. Only a safe and secure country can guarantee economic growth and prosperity for its citizens.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Air Force has taken on a more significant role in the hotspots of banditry in the North Central and North West in recent months, deploying attack aircraft to support the efforts of the Army. And we are already seeing the effects of this intensification of military operations.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As Commander-in-Chief I am extremely pleased by the gallant performance of our troops, on the various operations to which they’ve been deployed. On behalf of all Nigerians let me express how grateful we are as a nation for all that they’re doing to keep us safe and secure. https://t.co/lnta8H9h9c

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Before I left Katsina yesterday, I met with military personnel taking part in the fight against banditry in Zamfara and neighbouring States. I’m very pleased with the way they are firmly dealing with the bandits and criminals.  down. Nigerians deserve peace and security. https://t.co/OTr8PTHdH9

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: For our agriculture policy to succeed, we must be able to reach small farm holders with loans without collateral.  Collateral is always a problem with smallholder farmers. The Federal Government is fully committed to implementing policies that will promote agriculture in Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are working to make it easier for traders and farmers to access loans. The Bank of Industry has recently launched a collateral-free scheme for traders. And I have directed the Ministry of Agriculture and the CBN to review the loan issuance process for our smallholder farmers.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I remain very grateful to the people for their enthusiastic reception. And let me say that we will not be distracted by politicking or anything else. The security and welfare of all Nigerians, young, old, female, male, remain our priority.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: People who know me know that I am not given to chasing cheap political points. The crowd in Daura were not seeing me so I came out of the car so they could see me. I didn’t and don’t need to walk to convince anyone about my health and the decision to contest for a second term.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Much has been said about my walk in Daura,a few days ago. I didn’t do it to prove my fitness to anybody. The people of my constituency came out in large numbers to see me, & the car in which I was had tinted windows. So I decided to come out of the car so the people could see me.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I welcomed them to my ancient town of Daura, and asked them to enjoy their service year, and the hospitality of the people. Regardless of where they’re from, Daura is also their home, and I hope that in the years to come they will look back to this time with fond memories. https://t.co/yPPk5fHdeV

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Many of the Corps members posted to Daura are from southern Nigeria,and have never lived in or experienced this part of the country. For them to be brought to the desert or near the Sahel region is a difficult thing, but I have no doubt it will make a positive impact on Nigeria. https://t.co/zatHHfATGJ

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: One of the Sallah traditions I look forward to the most is the visit by Youth Corpers posted to Daura. I think the NYSC is one of the best things that has happened to Nigeria, because of the opportunity it gives young Nigerians to see and know different parts of the country. https://t.co/xysoAbdLK6

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @ProfOsinbajo: Happy Eid El-Kabir to everyone celebrating.

Have a joyous celebration. https://t.co/9v9nuVCBc6
retweet_text:
Happy Eid El-Kabir to everyone celebrating.

Have a joyous celebration. https://t.co/9v9nuVCBc6

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I felicitate with all Nigerians, particularly the Muslim faithful, on this year’s celebration. I assure you all that our administration will not rest or relent as we work to build the Nigeria of our dreams—secure, prosperous and free from the ravages of corruption.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On this occasion of Eid-ul-Adha, I urge all Nigerians to rise above personal, group, sectarian and other interests, and to promote harmony and tolerance in dealing with one another at all times.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We must imbibe this lesson and make it a duty to sacrifice for others and to always remember those who are less fortunate than ourselves. Selfishness, greed and corruption have no place in our lives and in our dealings with one another.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Eid-ul-Adha offers an opportunity to remember the submission of Prophet Ibrahim Alaihis-Salam to Allah, by which he taught the world the value of sacrifice in relating with one another.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We remain committed, as an administration, to guaranteeing the security of lives and property in every part of Nigeria. I am pleased to note the progress we are making, but we will also ensure we do not relent. We will deal decisively with all forms of banditry and criminality.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today the Security Chiefs briefed me on ongoing operations in various flashpoints across the country: Operations Lafiya Dole, Whirl Stroke I and II, Sharan Daji, and others. I commend all our security personnel on the frontlines, working hard to secure every part of #Nigeria https://t.co/twHkjLCf0c

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I thank my colleagues for the Honour; they refused to take my ‘No’ for an answer. I would like to specially thank my predecessor, President of Togo, Faure Gnassingbe, for his excellent stewardship of ECOWAS. And I look forward to hosting the next Meeting in Abuja in December. https://t.co/M4Dhhg41dO

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Truly humbled by my election today as the new Chairman of the Authority of Heads of State and Government of ECOWAS. I pledge to serve and work with my fellow Heads of State to deliver on peace, security, good governance and socio-economic development in the region. https://t.co/SsZnVNaEun

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our security agents have arrested hundreds of suspects across the flashpoints, and investigations and prosecutions are ongoing in several cases. I acknowledge that more needs to be done in this regard; we are counting on the full cooperation of the Judiciary to achieve this.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are seeing improved cooperation between the Military, Police, DSS and Civil Defence Corps, and also prioritizing intelligence gathering; as well as increasing the use of air assets and surveillance technology to locate and neutralize the criminals responsible for these attacks

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In the face of the evolving security threats, in the North Central and North West, we remain determined to neutralize every form of banditry and criminality. What we will never do is abandon any part of Nigeria to terrorists and criminals.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have authorized the deployment of a 1,000-strong Military Force to tackle the troubling security challenges in Zamfara. We have another Special Military Force, of about the same size, in Benue, covering Nasarawa and Taraba as well. In Plateau we have Operation Safe Haven.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Peace and Security will be at the top of our Agenda at the ECOWAS/ECCAS Summit today in Lome, Togo. We will discuss ways of forging a decisive and lasting response to our common security challenges. Regarding security, a regional approach is just as important as a domestic one. https://t.co/rYzS9wV8TA

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Even though Nigeria has, in the last three years, succeeded in cutting the importation by about 90 percent, parboiled rice is still being smuggled into the country, discouraging our farmers and undermining our goal of self-sufficiency in rice production. This is why we must act. https://t.co/bGVPCyH3DL

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Yesterday, President Talon of Benin and I agreed to set up a Joint Committee to combat smuggling. We will also be working with Niger Republic on the issue. Smuggling continues to pose significant economic & security risks to Nigeria, and we must do everything we can to tackle it. https://t.co/ZFvyewGEsx

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari’s Statement on today’s @nassnigeria defections from @OfficialAPCNg: https://t.co/xL3NQZmJf5
#AsoVillaT…
retweet_text:
President @MBuhari’s Statement on today’s @nassnigeria defections from @OfficialAPCNg: https://t.co/xL3NQZmJf5
#AsoVillaToday https://t.co/6XOk7XvFzL

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am using this opportunity to restate my total commitment to the values of democracy, as well as my total willingness to work with ALL members of the National Assembly, irrespective of their political party, for the benefit of Nigeria and Nigerians.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me also note that none of the defecting federal lawmakers has any specific grievances against me or the government I lead; neither do I harbour any ill-feeling towards any of them. I fully respect their freedom to choose what party to associate with.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As the saying goes, all politics is local. We understand that some of the Distinguished and Honourable lawmakers have issues in/with their home states, especially on zoning which bars some of them from seeking another term in their constituencies.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am confident that no harm or injury will be done by these defections, to the APC and its aspirations. I urge party faithful to not despair, but to instead see this as something that happens in seasons like this, on the eve of elections.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I wish all of our party members who today defected, the very best in their future undertakings. The APC has done its best to stop the defections, and I must commend the party leadership for working tirelessly to unite the party and position it for future victory.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigeria is committed to pursuing this partnership with vigour and determination. Our deep gratitude to President Mahamadou Issoufou, and the Government of the Republic of Niger, for collaborating with us for this important and mutually beneficial investment journey.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I also inaugurated two Committees, a Steering Committee to be co-chaired by the Nigerian & Nigerien Petroleum Ministers, to provide strategic leadership for the project;and a Technical Team to develop the implementation roadmap & strategy on both the refinery & pipeline projects.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The initiative will not only provide a reliable market for the stranded crude oil from Niger Republic, but will also provide petroleum products for Nigeria, as we aggressively pursue our aspiration for petroleum product self-sufficiency. https://t.co/wnKha5arZT

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Pleased to announce that this morning in Abuja Nigeria and Niger signed an MoU for the Niger-Nigeria Hydrocarbon Pipeline & Refinery Projects. This cooperation, involving crude oil export from Niger & construction of refinery facilities in Nigeria is a win-win for both countries. https://t.co/Xra8BqWfjz

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our message as a Government, everywhere we go, is a simple and consistent one: that Nigeria is open for business and investment. From agriculture to technology to manufacturing, oil and gas, solid minerals, and infrastructure, Nigeria is a land of massive opportunity. https://t.co/KpwC03946z

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I was very pleased to hear directly from the CEOs about their investment & expansion plans for Nigeria. From Vlisco’s plan to invest in a Textile Park; to FrieslandCampina’s project that will utilize 100% locally sourced milk; and Cownexxion‘s interest in building cattle ranches. https://t.co/OPMKl79p6p

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The level of economic cooperation between Nigeria and the Netherlands is impressive. But we can do even more. We want Dutch businesses to not only build factories in Nigeria, but also source their raw materials locally instead of wholesale imports.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I had a productive meeting with CEOs of some Dutch companies today. We want more investment in Nigeria, and we are creating the environment for this, through our renewed focus on security, ease of doing business reforms, and the fight against corruption. https://t.co/ZZ95UxFAiw

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I met with Dutch Prime Minister @MinPres Mark Rutte this afternoon, in The Hague. Our discussion touched on, among other things, economic and security matters, and the humanitarian situation in the Northeast. The Netherlands will continue to be an important and valued partner. https://t.co/0sKyvhDJ5q

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The delegation presented me with this artwork, titled LIGHT, by a Nigerian artist called Toyin Loyo, who was also on the delegation. https://t.co/F5qgdFCI2P

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today in The Hague, I met with a group of Nigerians in the diaspora, led by Mr Julius Nwankpa. Everywhere I travel to, around the world, I’m impressed by the quality of Nigerians I see. At home and abroad, Nigerians are exceptional, high-achieving people. https://t.co/tMDzNcgPAg

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: VIDEO: President @MBuhari meets with Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte @MinPres at the PM’s Office in The Hague, 16 July 20…
retweet_text: VIDEO: President @MBuhari meets with Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte @MinPres at the PM’s Office in The Hague, 16 July 2018. #PMBinTheHague https://t.co/7NaNLO2qjb

text: RT @NGRPresident: The delegation presented the gift of an artwork, titled Light, to the President. Toyin Loyo, the creator of the piece,tol…
retweet_text:
The delegation presented the gift of an artwork, titled Light, to the President. Toyin Loyo, the creator of the piece,told the President: "The work is illuminating. You bring light, which will never go out,and which will shine round the clock.”
#PMBinTheHague
#NigeriansInDiaspora https://t.co/M8N8NOir9i

#PMBinTheHague #PMBinNetherlands https://t.co/fBQGTITm9Y

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Vice President Osinbajo and I received the news of the APC victory in the Ekiti Governorship elections with great pleasure. Our party and our candidate, @kfayemi worked hard and the people of Ekiti have spoken loudly in our favour. And the ultimate winner is Nigeria’s democracy! https://t.co/NQ2X1fLWsS

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In all this, the people of Ekiti State have spoken loud and clear, and democracy has won again. https://t.co/U2lLYP0CP3

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
I urge the losers to be gallant in conceding defeat and to use constitutional means to settle whatever grievances they may have, instead of resorting to self-help.

And all stakeholders in Ekiti State must work towards a successful transition to the new administration.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me also commend the people of Ekiti State for their mature and peaceful conduct; INEC for adequate preparations and impartiality; the security agencies for staying on top of the security situation; and all local and international observers and monitors for their vigilance.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I urge Governor-Elect Fayemi and APC members to be magnanimous in victory as the incoming administration prepares to unfold a new lease of life for the people of Ekiti State through purposeful and responsible governance.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Ekiti State has decided. I congratulate Dr. John Kayode Fayemi on winning the governorship election. Commendation also goes to our great party, the APC, for the hard-fought victory after a dignified campaign.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Others are the Minister of Agriculture, Audu Ogbeh; Minister of State, Industry, Trade and Investment, Aisha Abubakar; Gr…
retweet_text: Others are the Minister of Agriculture, Audu Ogbeh; Minister of State, Industry, Trade and Investment, Aisha Abubakar; Group Managing Director, Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC), Maikanti Baru; and Managing Director, Nigerian Ports Authority (NPA), Hadiza Bala-Usman.

#PMBinTheHague

retweet_text: President @MBuhari will tomorrow, Sunday, July 15, 2018, depart for the Netherlands to participate in activities to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the adoption of the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court (ICC), at The Hague.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: What my election as Nigerian president – much due to a campaign made possible by mass communication – has taught me is that democracy’s strength comes from this accountability, and the demand that the rights of all are equally upheld.—https://t.co/34A4k6a0fE

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @AsoRock: President @MBuhari now inspecting the newly built Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport terminal. The terminal is expected to b…
retweet_text:
President @MBuhari now inspecting the newly built Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport terminal. The terminal is expected to be commissioned by Mr. President before end of this year, the Aviation Minister, Sen. @HadiSirika discloses.
#GovtAtWorkNG https://t.co/AcLHDDYap5

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our commitment to the vision for a modern, integrated rail system for Nigeria is total. The 2nd phase of the Abuja Light Rail will connect more parts of the city, while our standard-gauge National Rail is also taking shape, with the Lagos-Ibadan leg currently under construction. https://t.co/iFHzRefYud

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Abuja Light Rail System is further evidence that we are a government that delivers on its promises. A modern rail service will greatly boost the FCT economy and enhance social life. #AbujaMetro https://t.co/G57zhfVxc0

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This morning I formally commissioned  the Abuja Light Rail System. The completion of this very important project is a dream come true, and clearly demonstrates our administration’s commitment to the realization of critical infrastructural projects. #AbujaMetro

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: That this contract signing is happening after an 8-year delay is a clear indication of rising investor confidence in Nigeria. It is also a milestone for the Niger Delta region, which rightly yearns for more development projects. The project is expected to create about 8,000 jobs.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The signing of the MOU between the NLNG, the B7 JV Consortium and the SCD JV Consortium yesterday in London is an important step on the way to the new NLNG Train 7 that will increase Nigeria’s gas output from 22 million metric tonnes per annum to 30 million MT per annum.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I congratulate the board, management, staff and shareholders of the Nigerian Liquefied Natural Gas company(NLNG), NNPC and other Joint Venture partners, Shell, Total & AGIP on the signing of the contracts for the Front End Engineering Design (FEED) of Train 7 of the NLNG Project.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I came into office in 2015 through a free and fair election. In our party, the APC, we do not believe in manipulation of electoral processes. The will of the people must matter. And here in Ekiti, we will FULLY uphold free and fair elections, without manipulation of any form.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Dr. @kfayemi served as Minister of Mines & Steel Development and recorded impressive achievements. And with his experience as one-term Governor of Ekiti State, meaningful development is guaranteed. Good people of Ekiti, don’t waste your vote. Vote for Development! Vote for APC! https://t.co/nWsmgtZW5E

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I had the pleasure of joining the leadership of our party, the All Progressives Congress (APC), at a Grand Rally in Ado Ekiti, to present our Governorship candidate in Saturday’s elections, @kfayemi, to the good people of Ekiti State. https://t.co/QhGRaONOWh

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Regardless of the challenges the Nigerian judiciary is currently facing, it is one of the cornerstones of our democracy, and no one should be allowed to undermine it. The Supreme Court has spoken, and our democracy is stronger for it.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This is exactly what I did in the three elections in which I contested, before 2015. I was cheated, and I went to court each time, a firm believer in the primacy of the rule of law. The fourth time, God made it possible for me to be victorious and emerge as President of Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Senate President @bukolasaraki has persevered through what has no doubt been a tortuous judicial process. In the end, he has established his innocence; the highest court of the land, the Supreme Court, says he is not guilty as charged.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This afternoon I received a courtesy visit from members of the Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) from the 19 Northern States and Abuja, led by Rev. Dr. Yakubu Pam. My remarks in full, at the event: https://t.co/U3UIgW30GL #SecuringNigeria https://t.co/GFXu34U640

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: To put things in perspective, the total amount involved in some ongoing prosecutions of high-profile corruption related cases, from available records, is N595.4 billion. Compare this with the highest appropriation in the 2018 Budget, which is N344bn, going to @FMPWH for roads.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As a government we recognise that there are more grounds to cover in the war against corruption, and we are prepared to go all out and cut off any means that facilitate corruption and support its growth, while also strengthening our policies and institutions.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This is a good time, after three years in office, to review our achievements, and where necessary, re-appraise our anti-corruption strategy. Like I have said many times before, if Nigeria does not kill corruption, corruption will sooner or later kill Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: ... sponsorship of ethnic or religious violence, economic sabotage & cases of economic and financial crimes, including acts contributing to the economic adversity of the Federal Republic of Nigeria and against the overall interest of justice and the welfare of the Nigerian State.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It will deprive alleged criminals of the proceeds of their illicit activities which can otherwise be employed to allure, pervert and/or intimidate the investigative and judicial processes for acts of terrorism, financing of terrorism, kidnapping...

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Executive Order No. 6 of 2018 will restrict dealings in suspicious assets that are subject to investigation or inquiry bordering on corruption, in order to preserve such assets from dissipation.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It has become necessary to re-tool our arsenal to be able to more effectively tackle corruption in Nigeria, & ensure that justice is not defeated/compromised by persons involved in corruption. It‘s in consequence of this that I have decided to issue Executive Order No 6 of 2018.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I thank President Macron for his understanding and his commitment towards Nigeria and West Africa. We will continue to work with France for the benefit of both countries, in security, the fight against corruption, the economy, and in tackling the effects of climate change. https://t.co/itY8Gr1W4f

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: France is vital to Nigeria. When I assumed office, my first ports of call were our neighbours, Chad,Niger, Cameroon and Benin, which all happen to be former French colonies. It was the sensible thing to do. When you develop good relations with your neighbours it yields dividends.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Pleased to welcome President @EmmanuelMacron to the State House today. Our discussions focused on security, especially regarding G5S and stabilizing the Sahel; economic issues; and the Inter Basin Water Transfer for Lake Chad. Our two countries also signed a number of Agreements. https://t.co/dNesHfozBp

text: RT @NGRPresident: A Police Special investigation Team, comprising the Intelligence Response Team (IRT), Special Tactical Squad (STS) and Ta…

text: RT @NGRPresident: The Inspector General of @PoliceNG has since yesterday deployed the Police Special Intervention Force to Plateau State to…

name: Muhammadu Buhari

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Not only shall the labour of our heroes past never be in vain; the labour of the current generation shall also be rewarded. God bless our great party, and God bless the Federal Republic of Nigeria. https://t.co/a1HJWSKJMf

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Together, we will all build a cohesive party; that will do Nigeria a world of good. The APC will serve Nigeria to the best of our God-given abilities.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I thank and congratulate members of the immediate past executive, led by Chief John Odigie Oyegun, for their selfless service to our party, and urge them to always lend the wisdom of their experience to the new executive members.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I believe we have put in place an executive that we all can be proud of, one that would lead the APC from victory to victory, from progress to progress, and one that Nigerians can be proud of.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me remind all APC members that we belong to one party, and it is not about winners-take-all. Rather, the purpose is to build a party that would put its best foot forward, and serve Nigeria to the best of its ability.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I must also commend the Convention Committee under the leadership of Governor Badaru Abubakar, for providing a level playing field and instilling confidence in both aspirants and delegates with their thorough approach and adherence to transparency.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I commend all the delegates from across the country for their sacrifice and patience, travelling from far and wide to fulfill their obligations to the party, and to democracy. Thank you for your commitment.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As I said yesterday, I‘m confident that  despite a few lingering issues, the APC is emerging stronger from this Convention. I will continue to ask all those who have grievances to keep faith with the party; we will not relent until we have put all things right.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are members of one party, and it is not about winners takes all. Rather, the purpose is to build a party that would put its best foot forward, and serve our country to the best of its ability.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Everything was done in an atmosphere of give and take, knowing that in such contest, only one person would ultimately win. Let the victors be humble in victory, and let those who didn't win be gallant and gracious in defeat.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I salute aspirants who for the common good, had to shelve personal ambition, and stood down for others they were to have contended with. I also salute those who went the whole way, contested, were voted for, and who emerged victorious, or otherwise.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me salute the patience, forbearance, and spirit of accommodation that has been on display as our party, the All Progressives Congress (APC), held elections to fill positions in the National Working Committee (NWC) and the National Executive Committee. https://t.co/ea1J6lONzN

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
Read my full Speech at the Budget Signing, here: https://t.co/bIWiOSpXbc
#Budget2018 https://t.co/xsBpcbv4zh

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: However, it is my intention to seek to remedy some of the most critical of these issues through a supplementary and/or amendment budget which I hope the National Assembly will be able to expeditiously consider.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Notwithstanding the above stated observations, I have decided to sign the 2018 Budget in order not to further slowdown the pace of recovery of our economy, which has doubtlessly been affected by the delay in passing the budget.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: An example of this increase is the budget of the National Assembly itself which has increased by 14.5 billion Naira, from 125 billion Naira to 139.5 billion Naira without any discussion with the Executive.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Another area of concern is the increase by @nassnigeria of the provisions for Statutory Transfers by an aggregate of 73.96 billion Naira.  Most of these increases are for recurrent expenditure at a time we are trying to keep down the cost of governance.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Regrettably, however, in order to make provision for some of the new roads, the amounts allocated to some strategic major roads have been cut by the National Assembly.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: About seventy (70) new road projects have been inserted into the budget of the Federal Ministry of Power, Works and Housing @FMPWH. In doing so, @nassnigeria applied some of the additional funds expected from the upward review of the oil price benchmark to the Ministry’s vote.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Take-off Grant for the Maritime University in Delta State, a key strategic initiative of the Federal Government, was cut from 5 billion Naira to 3.4 billion Naira.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The provision for Construction of the Terminal Building at Enugu Airport was cut from 2 billion Naira to 500 million Naira, which will further delay the completion of this critical project.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The provisions for Export Expansion Grant (EEG) and Special Economic Zones/Industrial Parks, which are key industrialization initiatives of this Administration, were cut by a total of 14.5 billion Naira.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: At a time when we are working with Labour to address compensation-related issues, a total of 5 billion Naira was cut from the provisions for Pension Redemption Fund and Public Service Wage Adjustment.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Provisions for some nationally/regionally strategic infrastructure projects such as Counterpart funding for Mambilla Power Plant, 2nd Niger Bridge/ancillary roads, East-West Road, Bonny-Bodo Road, Lagos-Ibadan Expressway & Itakpe-Ajaokuta Rail were cut by an aggregate of N11.5bn.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Such examples of projects from which cuts were made are as follows:

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As it is, some of these projects relate to matters that are the responsibility of the States and Local Governments, and for which the Federal Government should therefore not be unduly burdened.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Many of the projects cut are critical and may be difficult, if not impossible, to implement with the reduced allocation. Some of the new projects inserted by @nassnigeria have not been properly conceptualized, designed and costed and will therefore be difficult to execute.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Unfortunately, that has not been given much regard in what has been sent to me. The National Assembly made cuts amounting to N347 billion in the allocations to 4,700 projects submitted to them for consideration and introduced 6,403 projects of their own amounting to N578 billion.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am however concerned about some of the changes @nassnigeria has made to the budget proposals I presented. The logic behind the Constitutional direction that budgets should be proposed by the Executive is that, it is the Executive that knows & defines its policies & projects.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: A few minutes past noon today, I signed the 2018 Appropriation Bill into Law. #Budget2018 https://t.co/zQfE5BTPol

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The purpose of this Bill, now an Act of the NASS, following my signing today, is to promote the fiscal independence of the Legislative & Judicial Arms of State Governments. Amounts due to them shall now be paid directly to them, instead of through the Executive arm of the States.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I signed a Constitution Amendment Bill that provides for the funding of State Houses of Assembly and State Judiciaries directly from the Consolidated Revenue Fund (CRF). The Bill, now an Act of the National Assembly, alters Section 121 of the 1999 Constitution.

text:
4/
June 12, 1993 was the day millions of Nigerians expressed their Democratic will in the freest, fairest & most peaceful elections since our Independence. name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Military and Police are fully on ground in Benue, with a Special Intervention Force that will protect Benue, Nasarawa, Taraba and Zamfara States. ‘Operation Whirl Stroke’, which has recently kicked off, will hunt down these killers, and protect all vulnerable communities.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We must not succumb to the hate that they wish to sow; we must not fall for their evil machinations aimed at dividing us. Now more than ever before we must stand firm against their calculations to stoke religious conflict and plunge our communities into unending bloodletting.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As I’ve said before, these persistent killings are not spontaneous;there are clandestine forces with a sinister agenda to instigate war in Nigeria for selfish purposes. When they attack places of worship their aim is to turn Nigerians against one another on the basis of religion.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: These senseless, unwarranted attacks on innocent civilians are utterly condemnable. And we will not rest until we bring all of these killers, who belong to the lowest level of civilization, to justice. Our security forces are on full alert, to checkmate these evil attacks.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Vice President @ProfOsinbajo is in Benue today to again convey our deepest condolences to the Government & people of Benue, and the Catholic Church, as the priests and parishioners killed in the despicable attack on St. Ignatius Church, Mbalom, last month, are laid to rest.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I thank the Government and people of Benue and other affected States for their understanding and continued support, as we work to restore peace and security to all troubled areas.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are also engaging with State Governments and community leaders, to build trust and understanding and ensure that all grievances are identified and addressed.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have approved the sum of 10 Billion Naira for the rebuilding of affected communities, and tasked the Vice President to oversee the disbursement of the funds, to ensure that our goal of rehabilitation and rebuilding is achieved.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will ensure we secure their communities, and we will help them to return home to rebuild their lives and livelihoods, and get every child back to school.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are increasing security deployments in the North Central and North West, where there have been violent attacks on communities by bandits and criminals. In addition we are focusing on the humanitarian challenges; the welfare of all the displaced people now living in camps.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Federal government released over N1.2 trillion for capital projects in 2016 and N1.5 trillion in the 2017 budget, figures that are unprecedented in the history of our country. We accomplished a lot more with the much less that oil prices and a recession confronted us with.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigeria’s future is very bright. The economy has taken a turn for the better,our foreign reserves are approaching twice what we inherited, investor confidence is high, the Naira is stable. And just today the announcement that inflation has declined for the 15th consecutive month.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: VP @ProfOsinbajo in Benue State this afternoon, to visit and show support to IDPs. Our commitment to Benue and other Stat…
retweet_text: VP @ProfOsinbajo in Benue State this afternoon, to visit and show support to IDPs. Our commitment to Benue and other States affected by senseless acts of violence extends beyond improving security; we are also prioritizing the welfare and rehabilitation of displaced persons. https://t.co/tsYGCAamaO

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @AsoRock: In order to sustain the positive momentum so far experienced in Nigeria's #AgriculturalRevolution, President @MBuhari flagged…
retweet_text: In order to sustain the positive momentum so far experienced in Nigeria's #AgriculturalRevolution, President @MBuhari flagged off the rehabilitation of the 5,345 hectare & expansion of 778 hectare works at the Hadejia Valley Irrigation Scheme, in Jigawa, yesterday. #PMBinJigawa https://t.co/jsBON2pyqM

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are doing more with less, in everything. From our progress in Agriculture, to the modernization of Nigeria’s rail networks, to our Social Investment, and other initiatives; we will make positive impact across every part of Nigeria, create jobs, and grow & diversify the economy

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Among other projects, I flagged-off rehabilitation and expansion works on the 6,000-hectare Hadejia Valley Irrigation project. When completed it will serve more than 25,000 farmers. The World Bank is assisting us on the project, and we’re grateful for their support. https://t.co/6Lzk6ghaZl

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I spent the last two days in Jigawa State, seeing proof that Nigeria’s agricultural revolution is alive and well and on course. I have no doubt that we will deliver on our vision for a country that grows what it eats and produces what it consumes.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The APC takes internal democracy seriously, and the success of the Ekiti Primary, with more than 30 aspirants, further validates our party’s democratic credentials. Let me assure that we will continue to work hard to lead Nigeria to the next level of its development journey.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I would also like to commend all the participants in the keenly-contested Primary. I would like them to uphold the values and philosophy of the APC by joining hands to support Dr. Fayemi in the forthcoming elections.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations to @kfayemi on winning the APC ticket to contest the July 14, 2018 governorship elections in Ekiti State. I have no doubt that Dr Fayemi’s track record as a reformist—with a passion for education, health and welfare—will stand him in good stead in the elections.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari is back in Abuja. He arrived this evening from London.
retweet_text: President @MBuhari is back in Abuja. He arrived this evening from London.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I’m deeply saddened by the news of the passing of the Gen Secretary of the Christian Association of Nigeria, Rev (Dr) Musa Asake. This is a huge loss to the Christian community in Nigeria. I pray that God Almighty will grant his soul eternal rest, and comfort all who mourn.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Pres @MBuhari will tomorrow, Tuesday undertake a four-day trip to the United Kingdom, to see how doctor. He will return S…
retweet_text: Pres @MBuhari will tomorrow, Tuesday undertake a four-day trip to the United Kingdom, to see how doctor. He will return Sat, May 12th. On his return, the President’s 2-day State Visit to Jigawa, postponed because of the APC Ward Congresses, will now take place 14th & 15th May. https://t.co/UDwZvadQRW

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will continue to engage to resolve issues and ensure that our common goal of leadership and service, for the good of the country, is not undermined or sidetracked in any way. This leadership is what Nigerians elected us to deliver, and we will not let you down.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This afternoon, on my return from Daura, I met with the Senate President and Speaker of the House of Representatives, at the State House. I briefed them on my recent trip to the US to meet with President Trump, and we also discussed the 2018 budget. https://t.co/kyGyjWyb8I

text: I will be traveling to the United Kingdom tomorrow, to see my doctor, at his request. Will be away for four days; back in Abuja on Saturday, May 12.

text: I am not in politics for fun, frivolity or to amass wealth. I have always been driven by a deep sense of commitment to make a difference to the lives of our people. And my decision to seek a second term in office is informed by this passion to truly serve Nigeria and Nigerians. https://t.co/hfq6qjVuN8

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The APC Ward Congresses today are a demonstration of our firm belief in the ideals of democracy, and the supremacy of the Party’s Constitution. Also a reminder that politics should be driven, not by selfish ambition, but by a desire to serve the people and improve their lives.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I want to assure the people of Benue, and all Nigerians, that we will ensure that the assailants are apprehended and brought to justice for this vile and sacrilegious act.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This latest assault on innocent persons is particularly despicable. Violating a place of worship, killing priests and worshippers is not only vile, evil and satanic, it is clearly calculated to stoke up religious conflict and plunge our communities into endless bloodletting.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I extend my sincere condolences to the Govt and people of Benue State, the Mbalom community, and especially the Bishop, priests & members of the St Ignatius' Catholic Church, whose premises was the unfortunate venue of the heinous killings of worshippers & two priests by gunmen.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This week I met with a group of young Nigerians living in the UK. We had a long discussion about Nigeria: the opportunities wasted by a Party that failed to use the resources of the country for the good of its people, and how my administration is now correcting those failings. https://t.co/6DHP7G7jcR

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As long as I remain the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of the Federal Republic of Nigeria the Chibok girls will NEVER be forgotten. Everything possible will be done to have them reunited with their families.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Don't imagine for a moment that we have forgotten about our daughters or that we consider their freedom a lost cause. Not on my watch!

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are however not relenting. We will continue to persist, and the parents should please not give up. Don't give up hope of seeing our daughters back home again. Don't lose faith in our ability to fulfill our promise of reuniting you with our daughters.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We know that this is not the news parents want to hear after four years of waiting, but we want to be as honest as possible with you.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Unfortunately, the negotiations between the government and Boko Haram suffered some unexpected setbacks, owing mainly to a lack of agreement among their abductors, whose internal differences have led to a divergence of voices regarding the outcome of the talks.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My administration remains focused and determined to see that the remaining #ChibokGirls and Leah Sharibu return safely to their homes and their families. Rest assured that we are doing our very best to free the girls from their captors.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I appeal to the parents to keep their hopes alive regarding the return of their daughters. The recent safe return of more than 100 of the #DapchiGirls, following the determined efforts of the Federal Government, should give all of us confidence that all hope is not lost.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As we commemorate the 4th anniversary of the abduction of the #ChibokGirls tomorrow, April 14, let me again assure the parents and families that their daughters will never be forgotten or abandoned to their fate.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari’s New Vision for the Niger Delta is yielding results. Finally the Maritime University in Delta State k…
retweet_text: President @MBuhari’s New Vision for the Niger Delta is yielding results. Finally the Maritime University in Delta State kicks off. The President  in 2017 approved an increase in the take-off grant allocated to the University from the N2bn earlier announced, to N5bn. #NDNewVision https://t.co/oKQEYRe5Xu

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @JustinWelby: Honour to meet Nigerian President @MBuhari in London today. I offered support in seeking a sustainable solution to the her…
retweet_text: Honour to meet Nigerian President @MBuhari in London today. I offered support in seeking a sustainable solution to the herder-farmer conflict, and urged the President to secure 14-year-old Christian Leah Sharibu’s release from #BokoHaram: https://t.co/lRIsdBJHBq https://t.co/suFIc69hBn

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I received a visit from the Archbishop of Canterbury, Justin Welby and the Secretary General Worldwide of Anglican Communion, and former Archbishop of Kaduna, Josiah Idowu-Fearon. Our High Commissioner to the UK, Rtd Justice George Oguntade was also present. https://t.co/xYKMZCFN4I

text:

We will continue to…

text:
I am delighted to join our Christian brothers and sisters to commemorate this year’s Easter celebration. May it bring us renewed hope and confidence as a great nation. 

My 2018 Easter Message to the Nation: 

https://t.co/xFE9J6gPkh

text: RT @NGRPresident: Once again, I welcome you all to this meeting with the hope that we will promote, always, the highest interest of the par…
retweet_text:
Once again, I welcome you all to this meeting with the hope that we will promote, always, the highest interest of the party and of our people.

Thank you—President @MBuhari

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Fortunately, we have already approved a timetable for the holding of congresses and elections. I think these should be al…
retweet_text: Fortunately, we have already approved a timetable for the holding of congresses and elections. I think these should be allowed to go forward and all efforts should now be geared towards making them a great success.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: I am therefore of the firm view that it is better to follow strictly the dictates of our party and national constitutions…
retweet_text: I am therefore of the firm view that it is better to follow strictly the dictates of our party and national constitutions, rather than put APC and its activities at grave risk.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: This is not to talk of divisions that would arise, and is already arising within the party, when some of our members feel…
retweet_text: This is not to talk of divisions that would arise, and is already arising within the party, when some of our members feel that they are being denied the right to aspire to executive positions, or that internal democracy is not at play within the party.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Furthermore, I think if we deviate from the constitutional provisions,we might be endangering the fortunes of our party.…
retweet_text: Furthermore, I think if we deviate from the constitutional provisions,we might be endangering the fortunes of our party. If the tenure of our party executives can be legally faulted, then it means that any nominations & primary elections that they may conduct,can also be faulted.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: In this circumstance, what is expected of us is to conduct fresh elections, once the tenure of the current executives app…
retweet_text: In this circumstance, what is expected of us is to conduct fresh elections, once the tenure of the current executives approaches its end. A Caretaker Committee cannot remedy this situation, and cannot validly act in place of elected officers.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Furthermore, Article 31 of our Party Constitution provides that any principal officer wishing to re-contest or contest fo…
retweet_text: Furthermore, Article 31 of our Party Constitution provides that any principal officer wishing to re-contest or contest for another post, must resign from his current post at least one month before the election.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: While APC Constitution, Article 17(1) & 13.2(B), limits tenure of elected officers to 4 years, renewable once by election…
retweet_text: While APC Constitution, Article 17(1) & 13.2(B), limits tenure of elected officers to 4 years, renewable once by election, the 1999 Constitution of Nigeria (as amended), S223, also prescribes periodic elections for party Excos at regular intervals, which must not exceed 4 years.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: On my own part, I have taken some time to review and seek advise on the resolution. And what I found is that it contraven…
retweet_text: On my own part, I have taken some time to review and seek advise on the resolution. And what I found is that it contravenes both our party Constitution and the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: This motion was duly carried by a majority of members present at the last NEC Meeting, even though some of our party memb…
retweet_text: This motion was duly carried by a majority of members present at the last NEC Meeting, even though some of our party members have since spoken up very vehemently against it.  Others have even taken the matter to court.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: As we all know, a motion was moved at the last National Executive Committee meeting of February 27, 2018, to the effect t…
retweet_text: As we all know, a motion was moved at the last National Executive Committee meeting of February 27, 2018, to the effect that when the tenure of the current executives expire in June this year, they should be allowed to continue for one year.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: In particular, I think it is important for me to speak quickly on the contentious issue of the tenure of our National and…
retweet_text: In particular, I think it is important for me to speak quickly on the contentious issue of the tenure of our National and State Executive Officers.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: I am delighted to once again welcome you to this NEC Meeting of our great party. As we usually do, I hope we will take th…
retweet_text: I am delighted to once again welcome you to this NEC Meeting of our great party. As we usually do, I hope we will take the opportunity of this gathering to resolve outstanding issues & consolidate our plans towards making APC the strongest defender of the interests of our people.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Remarks by President @MBuhari at the National Executive Committee (NEC) Meeting of the All Progressives Congress (APC), i…
retweet_text: Remarks by President @MBuhari at the National Executive Committee (NEC) Meeting of the All Progressives Congress (APC), in Abuja today:

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: In this week's video, Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity @FemAdesina speaks on how the @MBuhari Admi…
