text:
RT @ProfOsinbajo: Today, I presided over a Govt/Private sector meeting on how to resolve the Apapa traffic gridlock. 
Last week, I flew ove…
retweet_text:
Today, I presided over a Govt/Private sector meeting on how to resolve the Apapa traffic gridlock. 
Last week, I flew over the Apapa for an aerial assessment of the situation. https://t.co/6Y6WqKHf8l

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations to our soaring Super Eagles, and to all Nigerians, on tonight's victory against Argentina.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me specially commend Governor David Umahi for his vision and commitment to the development of Ebonyi State. We are united by our unwavering commitment towards ensuring that the lives of our people are made better by our service. https://t.co/WQeW6dFHo6

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me make this clear: We will deliver on all our promises to you. I said it when I met with Southeast leaders last month in Abuja, in response to the issues they raised about the state of roads and infrastructure in the region. I'm saying it again: We will not let you down.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The welcome also came with 2 Chieftaincy titles: Enyioma 1 of Ebonyi, which I am told means Trustworthy friend of Ebonyi; & Ochioha Ndigbo, which means Leader of Igbo people. I am a strong believer in the unity of Nigeria. Our diversity should be a source of strength not weakness https://t.co/GJBJiH5tzg

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I thank the people of the Southeast for the enthusiastic welcome they've accorded me since I arrived this morning. From Enugu to Abakaliki, I have enjoyed a profuse display of warmth from everyone; political leaders, traditional leaders, citizens. I thank you all. https://t.co/yxNhRFFmIw

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
RT @NGRPresident: Enyioma 1 of Ebonyi and Ochioha Ndi Igbo 1. 

#PMBinSE https://t.co/JM2dVRUnoT
retweet_text:
Enyioma 1 of Ebonyi and Ochioha Ndi Igbo 1. 

#PMBinSE https://t.co/JM2dVRUnoT

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I touched on the situation in Kaduna, where Gov @elrufai is trying to implement important reforms. It's a very serious situation when teachers cannot pass the exams they're supposed to administer to their students. It underscores the urgent need for comprehensive national reform.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I just opened a Special Retreat of the Federal Executive Council on the challenges facing Nigeria's education sector. We've brought together Government officials, academic experts, civil society and development institutions for this all-important conversation.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The CAN delegation raised concerns about the allegations of one-sidedness in federal appointments. I assured them that we will look at it. I have already instructed that a list of all heads of parastatals be submitted to me. We will ensure that we treat all Nigerians equitably.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Following the meeting with Christian leaders, led by the President of the Christian Association of Nigeria, Rev Ayokunle, I met with a delegation of Muslim leaders, led by the Secretary General of Jama'atu Nasril Islam (JNI), Dr. Khalid Abubakar Aliyu. https://t.co/Q9RiVEimhT

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @AsoRock: President @MBuhari in a closed-door meeting with members and leadership of the Christian Association of Nigeria  (CAN) at the…
retweet_text: President @MBuhari in a closed-door meeting with members and leadership of the Christian Association of Nigeria  (CAN) at the Presidential Villa in Abuja. https://t.co/48wShvFGWo

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I just welcomed Christian leaders to the State House, for a meeting. At 2pm I will meet with Muslim leaders. Our diversity is one of the most important things about us as a nation, and we must do everything in our power to promote religious harmony and understanding. https://t.co/Yhi94eJnqs

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: Infrastructure continues to be one of the priorities of the @MBuhari Administration. New locomotives and coaches have arr…
retweet_text: Infrastructure continues to be one of the priorities of the @MBuhari Administration. New locomotives and coaches have arrived for Abuja-Kaduna rail #RailUPng #GovtAtWorkNG https://t.co/sY7C3cHCSR

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
@NGRPresident Doing More With Less; Keeping the Promise of Change. @nsia_nigeria has seen inflows of $500m under the @MBuhari Administration 
#GovtAtWorkNG #MoreWithLess https://t.co/edg8NoHvaJ

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
15/ Our SWF did not receive new investment for 4 years of record high oil prices.
But despite low prices, we invested an additional US$500m.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 14/ A new non-stop express Train service(1 hour 15min) between Abuja & Kaduna will launch by December 2017,to complement existing services

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 13/ We've commenced extension of the Lagos-Ibadan Standard Gauge Rail Line to connect Apapa & Tin Can Port Complexes. Completion by Dec 2018

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 12/ We have approved a N701bn Payment Guarantee Scheme that will assure GenCos of up to 80% payment on invoices, & restore sector confidence

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 11/ Since 2015 the TCN and NDPHC have invested and worked to expand Transmission capacity, so that today it can handle up to 7,000MW.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 10/ We're introducing innovative financing to bridge infrastructure gaps. Like private sector road interventions in exchange for tax credits

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 9/ In addition we have also been adjudged one of the world's Top 10 Reformers by the standards of the World Bank Doing Business Index.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 8/ Our target for this year's World Bank Doing Business Index was to move 20 places up. We moved 24. I commend VP @ProfOsinbajo and PEBEC.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 7/ 2008 Nigeria was ranked 120th on World Bank's Doing Biz Index. By 2015 when we took office,we'd fallen to 169. In 2017 we're up 24 places

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 6/ In the 2016 Budget we invested 1.2 Trillion Naira in infrastructure. This is the highest ever in Nigeria's history. We will do even more.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 5/ Our Social Investment Prog is feeding 4.5m Schoolchildren; employed 200,000 unemployed graduates; & disbursed loans to 250,000 businesses

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 4/ We've kick-started the abandoned Itakpe-Ajaokuta-Warri Rail Line, unfinished for over 17 years. We expect to commission it by Sept 2018.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 3/ The Bonny-Bodo Road, conceived decades ago and then abandoned, is now back on course, jointly funded by the FGN and Nigeria LNG Limited

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 2/ All of the 100 billion Naira we raised from our recent Sukuk financing is going into the development of 25 key roads across Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 1/ Abuja Metro Rail, only 50% completed as at 2015 when we took office—after 8 years. I'm proud to say we've now taken it to 98% completion.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I will leave with you a few highlights from my speech today. Some of the evidence of the CHANGE we promised and continue to speak about.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
2 points I'd like to reiterate:
1. The quickest solutions not always the best
2. Only Nigerian solutions can fix Nigeria's unique problems

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I will never tire of repeating this: a new era is here, the old Nigeria is surely disappearing. We must work together to sustain this CHANGE

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I thank you for your support and goodwill. As we emerge from a very difficult economic period, I'm confident that a new Nigeria beckons.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me reassure all Nigerians of our determination to bring succour to you, to improve your lives, and deliver on our promises to you.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I appeal to the National Assembly to swiftly consider & pass the 2018 Appropriation Bill.Let us work together to strengthen our relationship

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I cannot but commend the patriotism & collaboration of the National Assembly, in our collective effort to move Nigeria forward. I thank you.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This afternoon I presented the 2018 Budget Proposal to a joint session of the National Assembly. https://t.co/MjnCOTauZ2

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @ProfOsinbajo: Nigeria has moved up 24 places to 145th in the World Bank’s ‘Doing Business’ report published today. https://t.co/kyxJPJH…
retweet_text: Nigeria has moved up 24 places to 145th in the World Bank’s ‘Doing Business’ report published today. https://t.co/kyxJPJHWBM

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm deeply grieved to learn of the passing of Jide Tinubu. My deepest condolences to the Tinubu family on this sad and painful loss.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I look forward to even greater achievements that will make a difference in the lives of all Nigerians. We will not let you down.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I particularly commend PEBEC, chaired by Vice President @ProfOsinbajo, for this job well done in improving Nigeria's business environment.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We also want foreign business visitors to obtain their visas on arrival; & pass through our airports & do their businesses with ease & speed

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We want our people to be able to register their businesses speedily; access land & credit & obtain licenses without bureaucratic bottlenecks

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our goal is to make it easy for people - Nigerians and foreigners alike - to invest and do business in Nigeria. I'm pleased by this progress

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I also congratulate all Stakeholders: the Presidential Enabling Business Environment Council (PEBEC), the National Assembly, & State Govts.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I congratulate all Nigerians on this landmark achievement, which symbolizes the success of our Ease of Doing Business Reforms.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The news that Nigeria moved 24 places up in the World Bank Doing Business rankings released today is most welcome. I'm very pleased by it.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our Change, the Change that the APC represents, is here to stay. We will stay united as a Party & continue to work for the good of Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will expand the Federal Executive Council to bring in more people and fresh ideas, for the ultimate benefit of the people of Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Regarding concerns about the representation of our supporters in the Federal Government, rest assured that this is also being looked into.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I know that our supporters are also very eager for these Board appointments to be announced. By God's grace they will be announced soon.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I said last year that we would shortly reconstitute the Boards of Parastatals. I regret the fact that we've not done so, for many reasons.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nevertheless, we will not rest on these achievements. There are still quite a number of challenges before us, and we are well aware of these

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today,the World Bank released its latest Business Rankings report. We moved up 24 places,& are one of the world's 10 most improved countries

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Internationally, Nigeria's prestige and credit-worthiness have gone up. We have regained our respect on the International stage.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We've seen regular supply of petroleum products, a successful Presidential Fertilizer Initiative; & TSA Implementation. This change is real.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The APC is proud of our achievements in the last 2 years: the fight against Boko Haram, Agric Revolution, Improved Power, Peace in the Delta

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I must therefore thank all stakeholders, as well as a number of non-APC members who have consistently risen above petty partisan interests.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am aware that it is sometimes easier to manage failure than to manage success—especially the kind of big success the APC achieved in 2015.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have a long list of people I would like to thank: our Party leadership, the leadership of the National Assembly, our State Governors.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I attended a Meeting of the National Executive Committee of our party, the All Progressives Congress.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: That said, the integration agenda is a welcome one, & Nigeria will surely play a leading role—as long as all concerns are properly addressed

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigeria's recommendation is for the constitution of an expert committee to come up with an acceptable Roadmap, and timelines and budget.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We must not lower the criteria or be in a hurry simply because we want to achieve a monetary union.  There is still a lot of work to be done

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our view is that ECOWAS member states are not yet fully prepared for a monetary union.This has always been one of Nigeria's primary concerns

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigeria will caution against any position that pushes for a fast-track approach to monetary union, while neglecting pertinent issues.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Regarding integration, it is important to take into consideration our varying economic conditions,as well as the lessons unfolding in the EU

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today in Niamey I urged ECOWAS countries to proceed with caution regarding the push for a single regional currency by 2020.

text:

text: RT @NGRPresident: President @MBuhari has directed the immediate disengagement of Mr. Abdulrasheed Maina from the Federal Civil Service.
retweet_text: President @MBuhari has directed the immediate disengagement of Mr. Abdulrasheed Maina from the Federal Civil Service.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: There is no one who doesn't see that there's been a considerable improvement of security in the N/East. But we will not let down our guard.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I highlighted our success in moving Boko Haram out from their strongholds. Even their attacks on soft targets are becoming less frequent.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our discussion also touched on the fight against terrorism, where we have recorded significant progress.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I told PM Abbasi that Pakistan should take full advantage of the new investment climate in Nigeria—product of our @EBESnigeria reforms. https://t.co/UpY2IqdLgX

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The performance of our countries in relation to trade and industrial cooperation has however been very disappointing. We need to do more. https://t.co/4Wbf7OkdEL

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My bilateral meeting with Pakistani PM Shahid Khakan Abbasi was fruitful. We have a long history of defence and military cooperation. https://t.co/HEriYDmo53

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On behalf of the government and people of Nigeria, I congratulate @akin_adesina and the @AfDB_Group family on the #WorldFoodPrize honour. https://t.co/fJAmKhfhgp

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I appeal to the communities in the region to continue to strive for peace through dialogue, to achieve conflict resolution.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our New Vision for the Niger Delta will ensure that the people of the region benefit from and enjoy the wealth of their land. #NDNewVision

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This is yet another demonstration of our commitment to fully deliver our New Vision for the Niger Delta #NDNewVision

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I signed into law a bill establishing the University of Petroleum Resources, Effurun, Delta State. #NDNewVision https://t.co/yC5pihPAPZ

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: When our children thrive, Nigeria thrives. We have a duty & responsibility to deliver a better Nigeria to them,and we will not let them down https://t.co/sYmfCzgLBB

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: You may know 3-year-old Maya Jammal, from her 'Baba Buhari' videos. Today it was my pleasure to meet her, Nicole Benson & Aisha Aliyu Gebbi https://t.co/g4LLwqi4rt

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me also use this opportunity to express my satisfaction with the mutually beneficial cooperation between Nigeria and China.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It is my firm belief that the CPC's 19th National Congress will usher in a new period of great accomplishment for the Party and for China.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On behalf of the Govt & people of Nigeria, I congratulate the Communist Party of China on the occasion of their 19th National Congress.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will work honestly and faithfully with every region of Nigeria, for the good of all. We will not let anyone down.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I want the Southeast to rest assured that we will deliver all the critical infrastructure projects we promised. https://t.co/pgxG52qbwt

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I thank the delegation for articulating their demands, and I promise that my administration will continue to serve every part of Nigeria. https://t.co/J5xaM3zj2v

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me again assure that we are committed to the delivery of these infrastructure projects, with funding support from China.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Projects like the 2nd Niger Bridge, East-West Road & Coastal Rail project, which will positively impact the Southeast, are a priority for us https://t.co/RvaDYVBYkR

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This afternoon I welcomed a delegation of South East leaders, led by Dep Senate President Ike Ekweremadu, to a meeting at the State House. https://t.co/KQcVzxQC1y

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I pray that the Almighty God will comfort their families and friends. My deepest sympathies go to the Government and people of Kaduna State.

name: Muhammadu Buhari

text: RT @NGRPresident: VIDEO: On Tue Sept 12, 2017, President @MBuhari commissioned @Olam's $100m Animal Feed Mill, Poultry Breeding Farms, & Ha…

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigeria is witnessing a revolution in Agriculture. Agriculture will create jobs for our young people, attract investment, & grow our economy https://t.co/bfzvzi8Q5h

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The old, import-dependent Nigeria is disappearing and a new Nigeria is rising in which we grow what we eat and consume what we make.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will not relent in our efforts towards achieving agricultural self sufficiency. We will continue to welcome and support more investment.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our vision is for a Nigeria in which we grow what we eat. It is possible, & we are on course to achieve it,with the private sector's support https://t.co/sWvKZhD5MI

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I commend the partnership between the Kaduna State Government and Olam, which has resulted in the factory complex I commissioned today. https://t.co/lBerfbFk7w

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Olam's investment in Poultry & Animal Feed Mills in Kaduna & Kwara is a strong vote of confidence in our economic diversification vision. https://t.co/4t5UDdXmLz

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today Vice President @ProfOsinbajo and I welcomed the National Council of Traditional Rulers of Nigeria to the State House. https://t.co/mJk1MugFOV

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: May the Almighty God grant peace to the souls of the victims and comfort to the grieving families and community.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our law enforcement agencies are already working to apprehend the perpetrators of the Plateau killings and whoever their sponsors may be.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We have a mandate and the determination to protect the lives and property of all citizens of Nigeria, wherever they reside.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Plateau's communities have achieved a lot in terms of mediation and peacebuilding. We will not allow a return to the dark days of anarchy.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It is unlawful and unacceptable for  anyone or group to take the law into their hands in the name of revenge or reprisals.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am saddened by the senseless killings that have taken place in Ancha village in Bassa Local Government, Plateau State.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me again assure of the full support of the Fed Govt,to the Govt & people of Benue State. Our agencies are on the ground,providing relief https://t.co/RQJceSRPJ3

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The real change for Nigerians is an impact that is felt in their lives and their pockets. We are on the right path, and our work continues. https://t.co/UTgTks4QcK

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm glad we're starting to see the fruit of our work.But there's still a lot to be done;we will not rest until all Nigerians feel the impact https://t.co/t8OvDH479z

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Until coming out of recession translates into meaningful improvement in people's lives, our work cannot be said to be done.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am pleased by the news of our emergence from the recession, and looking forward to ensuring that the ordinary Nigerian feels the impact.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let's celebrate our Super Eagles, holding Cameroon to a draw in Yaoundé. The march to #Russia2018 continues, and they have all our support! https://t.co/HBaOdHRZ3z

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me also commend the Akwa Ibom State Government for its continued support, and for the provision of excellent hosting facilities.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Football, like the NYSC, is a powerful unifying platform for us as a nation. Today's victory is for all Nigerians, at home & in the Diaspora

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations, Super Eagles, on the impressive win. We are looking forward to you sustaining the momentum in the return leg.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I join millions of football-loving Nigerians in applauding our Super Eagles for their skilful and entertaining display against Cameroon.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: #EidAlAdha https://t.co/8BuILbHlKk

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our rich diversity as a nation is and will always be one of our greatest strengths. It must never be used as a tool of hatred and division.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On a personal note, I recall that serving as an Army Officer in Lagos and Ibadan offered me very rich and fulfilling experiences.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I remain convinced that the NYSC offers a great opportunity to learn a lot about the diversity that has made Nigeria a unique country.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am always pleased to see Corps members in Daura and other parts of Nigeria. From the postings, we get to learn more about other cultures. https://t.co/9KTuaTUe6e

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: One of the highlights of my Eid-el-Kabir celebrations in Daura is the visit from NYSC members, after the prayers. https://t.co/6Bf8vuctGt

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I wish everyone happy Sallah celebrations. And may God bless the Federal Republic of Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Once again let me assure that this administration will not rest on its oars until we see the Nigeria of our dream.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This Eid-El-Kabir celebration is an opportunity for us all to rededicate ourselves to the exemplary virtues  shown by Prophet Ibrahim.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We must learn to see ourselves as brothers and sisters from the same heritage. And on our part as a Government, we will not let you down.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On this occasion, I appeal to all to keep our prejudices aside and strengthen the bonds of friendship & unity, to keep Nigeria together.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Your prayers and support have energised me to re-dedicate myself and this administration to the task of building a great Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me again thank all Nigerians who prayed for my recovery and have continued to extend their goodwill and support since my return.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I also congratulate our Muslim brothers and sisters who are currently in Saudi Arabia to participate in the rites of the Hajj.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I felicitate with all Nigerians, particularly the Muslim faithful, on the celebration of this year’s Eid-El-Kabir.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will surmount this disaster, and, working with the State Govt, bring succour and relief to all affected persons and communities.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My sympathies go to the Benue Govt & people.I assure that the FG will make available ALL assistance needed by the BSG & affected communities

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I will be monitoring and getting updates on the rollout of the Federal Government's humanitarian response to the Benue flooding disaster.

name: Muhammadu Buhari

text: Reviving and growing the economy was one of the main issues on which the APC campaigned; we will not rest until we have fulfilled this.

text: But we're also fully committed to taking advantage of the opportunities offered by these challenging economic times.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We inherited the most challenging economic situation in our history, affecting virtually every household, and every business.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm pleased with the progress we're making. Our Economic Recovery and Growth Plan is on course, as is the implementation of the 2017 Budget.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Special thanks to @flyethiopian for cooperating with us during this period, and for demonstrating intra-African cooperation in a real way.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Ministries of Transport and @FMPWHng, security agencies, @contactkdsg, Julius Berger and other stakeholders worked hard to deliver this.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I expect that this model of inter-agency cooperation and efficiency has come to stay, and will be consistently replicated across the Govt.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My gratitude goes to all who worked to ensure the successful completion of the runway work, & reopening of Abuja Airport, ahead of schedule.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Once again, I wish you all happy Easter celebrations.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will restore peace and stability across Nigeria, as the foundation for economic recovery, growth, and true prosperity.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will sustain the peace in the Niger Delta through engagements with stakeholders. We will fully implement our New Vision for the region.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will continue with the fight against terrorism and insurgency; we're determined as never before.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We've worked hard & will continue to work hard to improve security nationwide, sustain the fight against corruption & revitalize the economy

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I enjoin all Nigerians to keep faith in the determination & ability of this administration to change the Nigerian story for the good of all.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As a people we must rediscover the values of peaceful co-existence, social justice, religious tolerance, dignity of labour, and patriotism.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It is in our collective interest to live in peace, because without peace, no meaningful and sustainable development can take place.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As we celebrate, I urge all Nigerians to live peacefully with one another, and do their utmost to make Nigeria a beautiful place to live in

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The message of Easter is filled with themes of love, faith, sacrifice, hope, victory; as espoused in the teachings and life of Jesus Christ

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Easter signifies the triumph of good over evil, light over darkness, redemption over condemnation, and hope over despair.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I congratulate our Christian brothers and sisters on the celebration of this year’s Easter.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will never ever give up, whether on rescuing all captives, or on completely vanquishing Boko Haram. That remains our promise to you.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My special appreciation goes to the parents & families, who have endured 3 years of agony. I feel your pain. Your children are my children.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Regarding our Chibok girls, we must not lose hope. I trust God that soon, our collective efforts will be rewarded with their safe return.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me use this opportunity to remind all that last December our troops overran Boko Haram's Headquarters in the Sambisa Forest.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: For this we have our gallant Intelligence & Security forces to thank. We're also grateful to all International partners who've supported us.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today, BokoHaram has been degraded & is no longer in a position to mount serious attacks,other than sporadic suicide attacks on soft targets

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: At that time Boko Haram not only occupied the Northeast, but also unleashed fear and mayhem well beyond the region.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It is easy to forget where Nigeria was when this administration began 2 years ago,and Boko Haram held no fewer than 14 LGAs in the Northeast

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It was to ensure the freedom of all BokoHaram captives & recovery of lost territory that we gave the fight against terror our full attention

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We've reached out to the captors & are negotiating to ensure the girls' safe release. We're willing to bend over backwards to achieve this.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me also reiterate our absolute commitment to the freedom and safe return of the remaining Chibok girls, and all other abducted persons.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm eternally grateful to God for the return of 24 of the girls, as well as of thousands of other Nigerians forcibly abducted by Boko Haram.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today commemorates an incident that we will never forget: the abduction, three years ago, of schoolgirls from Govt Secondary School, Chibok

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Governors of Kaduna and Ogun States joined me for Juma'at Prayers at the State House this afternoon. https://t.co/EN0mjnDWcE

text: The Federal Government will fully support the Borno State Government in dealing with the situation and attending to the victims.

text: I received with regret news that the Air Force,working to mop up BH insurgents, accidentally bombed a civilian community in Rann,Borno State

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let us all continue to be vigilant in our communities,even as our security agencies combat the remnants of the insurgents and their sponsors

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Once again, my condolences to the families of the victims. And I wish the injured speedy & full recovery. Nigeria will triumph over terror!

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Boko Haram is a godless group; with no true understanding of Islam. Their actions are cowardly, and punishable before God and by our laws.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My heartfelt condolences go to the University Community, the families of the victims, and the Govt and people of Borno State.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I received the sad news of the terrorist attack on the University of Maiduguri this morning.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I look forward to working with the new Ohaneze Ndigbo leadership. My administration will continue to be a committed partner.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations to the eminently qualified Chief John Nwodo on his election as the President-General of Ohaneze Ndigbo.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our vision is to revitalise 10,000 PHC facilities across Nigeria—in phases. In Phase 1 we will deliver 109; one in each Senatorial District.

text: This morning in Abuja I flagged-off one of the cardinal programmes of our Administration – the Revitalization of Primary Health Care Centres

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The #GambiaMediation Meeting has now started. https://t.co/BOkvsb0bYu
retweet_text: The #GambiaMediation Meeting has now started. https://t.co/BOkvsb0bYu

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Tomorrow in Abuja, in my role as ECOWAS-mandated Mediator, I will host a meeting of West African leaders on the situation in The Gambia.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm hopeful that soon, Chibok community, Nigeria, and, indeed, the world, will welcome the remaining girls back home.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: And I salute our security agencies, whose efforts have resulted in the return of some of the girls, as well as thousands of other captives

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I also salute all who have been in the vanguard of the quest for the recovery of the girls, nationally and internationally.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I salute the fortitude of the distraught parents. As a parent myself, I feel their pain. The tears never dry, the ache lingers in our hearts

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our intelligence and security forces are unrelenting, and whatever it takes, we remain resolute in our quest to bring all our girls back.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me again say, as I have pledged in the past, that we will not spare any effort to reunite the remaining girls with their families.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In the last 9 months, 24 of the Chibok girls have been recovered/rescued, even as our gallant military has relentlessly subdued Boko Haram.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In my Inauguration speech I made it clear that bringing back our daughters was a priority, as important as the defeat of Boko Haram.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: April 14, 2014 instantly became a watershed moment for the nation; and a rallying point for the world, in the fight against terrorism.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 1,000 days ago, 276 of our daughters were taken away from us by Boko Haram terrorists.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Presidential Inauguration Day in Ghana. Glad to be here to witness a peaceful transition of power. I wish @NAkufoAddo & @JDMahama the best. https://t.co/4dinnLba8i

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I also again commend President @JDMahama for his maturity and statesmanship. Ghana has once again set a great example.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Looking forward to the inauguration of President-elect @NAkufoAddo, tomorrow in Accra. Congratulations again to the people of Ghana!

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am being regularly briefed on the situation. Let me again extend my deepest condolences to the victims of the violence.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am also aware that the Kaduna State Govt is carrying out peace-building efforts, to bring lasting resolution to the crisis.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have also since directed @nemanigeria to work with Kaduna's SEMA, to bring urgent aid to the victims of the violence.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The DSS is also working with the military and Police to provide Intelligence, to help tackle the crisis.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Army & Airforce are also in the region. @HQNigerianArmy is setting up two battalions while @NigAirForce is carrying out air surveillance

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Inspector-General of @PoliceNG has visited the region to assess the situation, and oversee deployments of conventional & mobile officers

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We have in the last one week taken important steps to end the killings and violence in Southern Kaduna, as I promised in my New Year Message https://t.co/65xajirbfW

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @ProfOsinbajo: Together, Nigeria will prevail!

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @ProfOsinbajo: At all times, we must remember that the bonds that hold us together, far outweigh the differences that separate us.
retweet_text: At all times, we must remember that the bonds that hold us together, far outweigh the differences that separate us.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @ProfOsinbajo: President @MBuhari and I are thankful for the opportunity to serve you. We are committed to improving Nigeria for you and…
retweet_text: President @MBuhari and I are thankful for the opportunity to serve you. We are committed to improving Nigeria for you and future generations

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @ProfOsinbajo: Happy New Year to the great citizens of Nigeria. https://t.co/FaezJ0U2Kn
retweet_text: Happy New Year to the great citizens of Nigeria. https://t.co/FaezJ0U2Kn

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I wish you all a Happy New Year. May the Almighty God continue to bless the Federal Republic of Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I urge you to continue to support this administration in its effort to transform Nigeria for the good of all.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I assure you again that the current pains are temporary and will ease when the economic seeds in gestation begin to bloom to fruition.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I thank you for the public support for our administration’s efforts to transform Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It will be unthinkable on my part to allow the boat of the anti-corruption campaign — a key campaign promise — capsize mid-stream.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our war on corruption will not spare any person, or organ of government.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our determination to wrestle corruption to the ground remains unshaken, and will be guided by respect for the rule of law and due process.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: They are the engine of our economic recovery, and their needs underpin our Economic Recovery and Growth Plan for 2017.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Farmers, SMEs, agro-allied businesses, dressmakers, entertainers, technology start-ups, will remain the true drivers of our economic future

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In pursuit of our administration’s philosophy, we will continue to appeal that we buy "Made In Nigeria" goods.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our economic recovery and growth plan in 2017 is anchored on optimizing the use of local content and empowering local businesses.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am optimistic that the CHANGE you voted for in 2015 will manifest more and be sustained in different sectors, in 2017

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our Agric revolution has begun. Farmers across Nigeria are experiencing bumper harvests; and states are getting into strategic partnerships.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On our efforts to turn around the economy, fight corruption, and diversify from oil & gas, I am encouraged that we are getting things right.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I also acknowledge and assert that the law enforcement agencies must treat our Shia brethren humanely and according to the rule of law.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our brothers and sisters of the Shia Community, we equally urge you to embrace peace. You must accept the laws of the country you live in.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: All who have taken to violent disruptions of economic infrastructure should instead join hands with us to find peace and ensure development

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will continue to pursue peace in the Niger Delta.Again I call on our dissatisfied brothers in the region to come to the negotiating table

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We have succeeded in harnessing our diversity for national development. We must continue to support one another and live together as one.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are courageous, hardworking, hospitable, steadfast and resilient people, even in the face of difficulties.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 2017 provides an opportunity for us to build on those aspects of our national life that unite us.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: An African proverb says, "it is easy to break a broomstick but not a bunch”. Nigeria is a bunch and is more than equal to all troublemakers.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our defence and security forces are more than ever before ready to perform their constitutional role of protecting lives and property.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In this New Year the lingering security issues in several states will be frontally addressed.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We're aware of some mistakes & wrongdoings in the handling of IDPs,and are taking measures to correct those mistakes and punish the culprits

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I urge state governments, privileged Nigerians, donor agencies and countries to redouble their contributions towards this goal.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will spare no effort in seeing to the resettlement and rehabilitation of the unfortunate victims of terrorism and insurgency.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The joyful, voluntary return of thousands of IDPs to Damasak, Borno State on Christmas Day reassures us that more of such is imminent.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On our own part we will ensure that misguided elements who take up arms against constituted authorities face the full weight of the law.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The support of all Nigerians for the work of our security agencies is crucial in our bid to effectively secure our country.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: To support the war on terror I urge all Nigerians to watch out for strange figures in their communities, and report to security agencies.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In 2016, 22 of our beloved Chibok girls were reunited with their families, giving us hope that those still in captivity will return safely.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Following the successful capture of Sambisa Forest, we have entered a new phase in our battle against our common enemy, Boko Haram.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Join me to again acknowledge the heroic efforts of our military and other security agencies on their remarkable successes against terrorism

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm happy to welcome you all to the beginning of a New Year. I have a New Year Message for all Nigerians—https://t.co/qpoLFlK1xn

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @AsoRock: Meet 18-year-old Hauwa Bulus. She learnt English in an IDP Camp in Maiduguri. And was one of the 18 winners of our @Protecting…
retweet_text: Meet 18-year-old Hauwa Bulus. She learnt English in an IDP Camp in Maiduguri. And was one of the 18 winners of our @ProtectingEdu Contest: https://t.co/WcVsEzQnag

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I remain optimistic that a peaceful resolution of the situation in The Gambia is possible before the January 19, 2017 Inauguration.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The main task of the MST is to undertake the preparatory work that will lead to a high-level meeting between me & all the stakeholders

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I've now asked Foreign Minister @GeoffreyOnyeama to work with President @JDMahama to lead a Mediation Support Team (MST)

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: At the Dec 17 ECOWAS Summit in Abuja I was asked to lead the Mediation of the situation in The Gambia, assisted by President @JDMahama

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: At the dinner, expressing gratitude, on behalf of the nation, to Maj-Gen Leo Irabor, Commander of the military operation against Boko Haram. https://t.co/o7qy5c3Jhf

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Boko Haram flag recovered from Camp Zero. The COAS, Lt. Gen. Buratai handed it over last night, at the Guards Brigade Regimental Dinner. https://t.co/3Y4ifFRzvj

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @AsoRock: Today, the Federal Govt will formally reopen two major roads in Borno State: the Maiduguri-Gubio-Damasak & Maiduguri-Mungono-B…
retweet_text: Today, the Federal Govt will formally reopen two major roads in Borno State: the Maiduguri-Gubio-Damasak & Maiduguri-Mungono-Baga Roads

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Merry Christmas!

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I wish all travellers safe journeys and a memorable holiday as we celebrate with our family and friends.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As we celebrate Christmas, let us reflect on the love of God aptly espoused in the teachings and lifestyle of Jesus Christ.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I rejoice with all Nigerians, particularly our Christian brothers and sisters, on this year's celebration of the birth of Jesus Christ.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'd like to appeal to all Nigerians to support the military by providing information that will expose terrorists hiding in our communities

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations to all our troops who contributed to this most commendable and momentous effort. May the Almighty continue to be with you.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Yesterday, @HQNigerianArmy captured 'Camp Zero', Boko Haram's Sambisa Forest base. My message to our gallant troops—https://t.co/ds9uCZY7qD https://t.co/oxcsjD13Aa

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: By next week about 33 State Governments would have received the first batch of the Debt Service Refunds I recently approved for payment.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In all we've issued close to N400bn in conditional bailout packages to the States, as well as helped restructure >N600bn of existing debt

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: It was to tackle this issue that I approved, in 2015 and 2016, two sets of bailouts, as well as debt restructuring, for affected States

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This issue of salary and pension debts must be tackled by State Govts with the urgency which it deserves. It must not be allowed to linger

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I've asked State Govs to make outstanding salaries/pensions a priority as they receive the 1st installment of their Debt Service Refunds

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @AsoRock: WATCH: PART 2: Vice President @ProfOsinbajo's meeting with Artisans and Auto Mechanics in Mpape, Abuja, on Thursday Dec 22. ht…
retweet_text: WATCH: PART 2: Vice President @ProfOsinbajo's meeting with Artisans and Auto Mechanics in Mpape, Abuja, on Thursday Dec 22. https://t.co/PGqGXw68hB

retweet_text: VP @profosinbajo was returning from the #DigitalSwitchOver launch in Abuja, today, and stopped at the Mpape Mechanic Village. This happened: https://t.co/pFWNTQ3tH8

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I remain optimistic that we will meet our target of self-sufficiency in rice by 2019. We will continue to make steady progress towards it.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On the part of the Federal Government, we will continue to support these initiatives through favorable policies and incentives.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I urge other State Govts to replicate the laudable example of LAKE Rice, not only in rice but also in other staple crops, and dairy products

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I commend Governors @AkinwunmiAmbode and Atiku Bagudu for fulfilling the MoU they signed in March 2016, to boost rice production https://t.co/Mu8eAHJvEi

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm proud of the successful agricultural partnership between Lagos and Kebbi States, which has produced LAKE (Lagos-Kebbi) Rice. https://t.co/9THA4mhMdF

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Pleased to welcome the President-elect of the Republic of Ghana, @NAkufoAddo, to the State House today. I look forward to working with him https://t.co/byPGzm0Za4

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Happy 54th Birthday to Senate Pres @bukolasaraki, one of the most influential politicians of our time. I wish you many more prosperous years

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I will continue to work for the good of Nigeria, and ask you all to join hands with me, and my Govt,to build a nation we can all be proud of

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I thank everyone who wished me a happy birthday yesterday. I received and acknowledge all your messages and kind wishes.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I wish @Pontifex a Happy 80th Birthday, today. It is my prayer that you will enjoy many more years of service to God and to humanity.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm grateful to @AminaJMohammed for her service to Nigeria, and have no doubt that in her new assignment she will continue to make us proud.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The incoming @UN Secretary-General António Guterres called this evening to inform me of the decision to appoint @AminaJMohammed

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I wholeheartedly endorse the choice of  of @AminaJMohammed as the next Deputy Secretary-General of the @UN. It is a great honour to Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The 3rd, a Warship, NNS UNITY, was built in China—product of our thriving diplomatic & defence relations with the People's Republic of China

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I pledge the continued total support of my administration to the Nigerian Military. We will continue to fund and equip you to do your work.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigerian Engineers at the @NigerianNavy Dockyard in Lagos & Naval Shipyard in P/Harcourt built NNS KARADUWA & Tugboat COMMANDER EDWIN UGWU

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today in Lagos I commissioned three new Naval Ships. I'm pleased to note that two of those Ships were built locally by @NigerianNavy.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Minister of Budget and National Planning will provide a breakdown of the highlights of the 2017 Budget estimates I presented today.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I must admit these negotiations took longer than expected, but I am optimistic that these projects will commence in 2017 for all to see.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In 2016, we invested a lot of time on the paperwork for these rail projects—negotiating the most beneficial deal for Nigeria and Nigerians.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: #Budget2017 contains N213.14 billion as counterpart funding for the Lagos-Kano, Calabar-Lagos, Ajaokuta-Itakpe-Warri railway, and others

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Infrastructure will be one of our biggest continuing priorities in 2017: Roads, Rail and Power projects.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have instructed that the Export Expansion Grant be revived in the form of tax credits to companies. N20 billion has been voted for this.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The new Development Bank of Nigeria will soon start operations with US$1.3 billion focused exclusively on Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: #Budget2017 contains N50bn as the Fed Govt's Contribution for development/expansion of new/existing Export Processing & Special Econ Zones

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The allocation for the Presidential Amnesty Programme has been increased to N65 billion in #Budget2017

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: #Budget2017 contains N500bn for the Social Investment Prog we launched in 2016: School Feeding, GEEP, @npower_ng, Cash Transfer & others

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Social Investments will continue to be a priority. #Budget2017 contains N100 billion seed money for the new N1 trillion Family Homes Fund

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We've tasked the Efficiency Unit of the Min of Finance to cut certain overhead costs by 20%, to free resources to fund capital expenditure.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: One priority for us in 2017 is to bring about greater coherence between monetary, fiscal and trade policies.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We'll continue our cost containment efforts. We've restricted travel costs, reduced sitting allowances,eliminated thousands of Ghost workers

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will continue to confront the inherited issue of indebtedness to contractors & other third parties, & negotiate realistic payment plans

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Implementation of the public-private partnership models we have developed, to deliver critical Infrastructure in power, roads and rail

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This is what you should expect from us in 2017:

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will resolve the liquidity issue in the power sector. On our part, Govt has made provisions in #Budget2017 to clear its outstanding debt.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: During 2016, we conducted a critical assessment of the power sector value chain, which is experiencing major funding issues.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigerians will begin to see the tangible benefits of our Infrastructure modernization in 2017.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Modernizing Nigeria's railway system is a priority in the 2017 Budget. In 2016, we made a lot of progress completing financing arrangements.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In 2017, we will focus on the rapid development of infrastructure, especially rail, roads and power.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I've established the Presidential Enabling Business Council, chaired by @ProfOsinbajo, w/ a mandate to make doing business in Nigeria easier

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Facilitation of business and commerce must be the major objective of government agencies. Government must not be the bottle-neck.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I will be issuing some Executive Orders to ensure the facilitation and speeding up of government procurements and approvals.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The new JV funding structure will positively impact Govt revenues, which will be allocated to Infrastructure, Agric, Mining & Manufacturing

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: From January 2017, the Federal Government will no longer make provision for Joint Venture (JV) cash-calls.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will also continue our ongoing reforms to enhance the efficiency of the management of our oil and gas resources.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our Econ Plan is the 'Economic Recovery and Growth Plan.' One of its cornerstones is promoting local content and empowering local businesses

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: A pleasure to present #2017budget Proposals to a Joint Session of @nassnigeria,presided over by @bukolasaraki, today—https://t.co/5tnjbjZfUt

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The mediation continues. After our meeting with President Jammeh we met with President-Elect Adama Barrow. https://t.co/4l88pPvsx2

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our meeting with President Yahya Jammeh, at the State House https://t.co/y6EHp5RG1Z

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will be asking President Jammeh to respect his country's Constitution, and to maintain the inviolability of the electoral process.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will meet with President Yahya Jammeh, and also with President-elect Adama Barrow.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am in The Gambia with other ECOWAS leaders to insist on the sanctity of the electoral process, and respect for the wishes of the people https://t.co/5nbCVMb8Pf

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As we celebrate and reflect, I wish all Nigerians a peaceful Eid-el-Maulud.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This week, I will present #Budget2017 to the National Assembly—it is part of a Plan we're confident will get us out of these difficult times

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: With collective dedication & hard work, we will overcome our economic difficulties, and return Nigeria to the path of prosperity.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We all share a vision of a better Nigeria, and we will all share in the responsibility of building the country of our dreams.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Instead, these current challenges should remind us of why we need to stay together, fight together and succeed together, as a nation.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The reality of the temporary challenges we're facing should not undermine our hope, or reverse our collective will to succeed, or divide us.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On this occasion, I urge you not to lose faith in the ability of this administration to make a positive difference in your lives.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I wish all Muslims a happy and memorable celebration. #Eidmiladunnabi

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today we mark Eid-El-Maulud, the birth of Prophet Mohammed (Peace Be Upon Him). Read my message to the nation—https://t.co/ej9GZAiElc

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Any tragedy that affects any part of Nigeria affects all of us. Our thoughts and prayers continue to be with the people of Akwa Ibom.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I pray that the souls of the deceased will rest in peace, and that the injured will experience quick recovery.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I asked the Governor to convey to the people of Akwa Ibom the deep sorrow felt by me, and by the entire country, over this tragedy.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This evening I spoke with Gov @MrUdomEmmanuel to commiserate with him on the tragic collapse of the Reigners Bible Church building in Uyo.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I wish Ghana a smooth transition of power, and look forward to working with President @NAkufoAddo

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Africa's future rests on building strong democratic institutions, ensuring credible elections, and respect for the sanctity of the ballot.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I particularly commend President @JDMahama for the great courage to call @NAkufoAddo and concede defeat.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I also salute the statesmanship of President @JDMahama, who came into office at a trying period for Ghana, and worked for a better country.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations to @NAkufoAddo on his historic win. The maturity and peaceful conduct of the election is a victory for all Ghanaians.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The battle against terrorism is a joint effort involving all of us. Together, Nigerians can AND WILL defeat the evil that is Boko Haram.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This latest attack is obviously an act of desperation, but the Nigerian military will neither be distracted, nor relent in its war on terror

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Putting an end to this senseless loss of innocent lives remains a top priority of our administration.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My heartfelt condolences to the families of the victims of the twin bomb blasts in Madagali, Adamawa State, today.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We remain committed to deepening democracy by building a legacy of respect for the people's wishes through free, fair & credible elections

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I enjoin @inecnigeria to do all within its powers to give transparency and fairness to the electoral exercise in Rivers State.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Elections should not be seen as do-or-die. Innocent blood should never be sacrificed on the altar of political contest for temporary power.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I urge all political parties, candidates & the people of Rivers to please ensure that tomorrow's polls take place without rigging & violence

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Management of the NYSC must continue to do all within its powers to protect the lives of those under its charge.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In particular I have asked for an independent investigation into the actual circumstances behind the death in Kano of Miss Ifedolapo Oladepo

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Chinyerum Elechi, Ifedolapo Oladepo & Monday Asuquo Ukeme, who passed on in Bayelsa,Kano & Zamfara, died answering the call to serve Nigeria

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm saddened by the deaths of 3 NYSC members during the 2016 Batch 'B' Orientation. It is sad and unfortunate. May their souls rest in peace

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I wish our Super Falcons the best in the #AWCON2016 final. I urge them to play with the confidence that the entire nation is behind them. https://t.co/AiLNZ7M61F

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I look forward to a smooth transition of power, and to working with the incoming President to deepen relations between Nigeria & The Gambia

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I also salute the spirit of statesmanship displayed by out-going President Yahya Jammeh, in conceding defeat.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I congratulate President-elect Adama Barrow. And the Gambian people, for peacefully exercising their democratic right to choose their leader

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Ministry of Finance is currently processing the first batch of 153 billion naira, which, I am told, will be released to 14 States.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We have stipulated that at least 50% of the funds should be dedicated to salaries &pensions, & will audit disbursements to ensure compliance

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have approved the disbursement of 522 billion naira to States, to enable them pay salary & pension arrears, and put money in the economy

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today Nigeria and Morocco signed an Agreement aimed at making us self-sufficient in fertilizer production. We will work to implement it.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I welcomed his Majesty King Mohammed VI of Morocco to Nigeria today. I look forward to our discussions, for the benefit of our two countries https://t.co/SLC3v855Ce

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I also received Senate President @bukolasaraki in my office today. Very soon I will present the 2017 budget to the National Assembly. https://t.co/EtA9mgPAZ8

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I received Governor-Elect @RotimiAkeredolu today, at the State House. Congratulations again, on your well-deserved victory! https://t.co/x7uZFndlqd

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Our Super Falcons have made Nigeria proud again. The entire country looks forward to the #AWCON2016 Final on Saturday. https://t.co/gvmx9Etdck

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Every time and anywhere I've served in Nigeria, we found it efficient and cost-effective to use Nigerian engineers. They're very competent.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have a lot of respect for Nigerian Engineers, having worked with them over the years, from my time as Petroleum Commissioner, to the PTF

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: President of the Nigerian Academy of Engineers (NAE), Mrs. Joanna Maduka,  decorating me as Grand Patron of the NAE, today https://t.co/3qbVzxPHhh

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations to our Super Falcons on their fantastic performance in the #AWCON2016. We're proud of you, & wish you all the best tomorrow! https://t.co/KF8LeJGhjs

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text:
A huge win! The unity & resilience of our party was tested — I'm glad we emerged victorious. 
Congratulations Gov-Elect @RotimiAkeredolu! https://t.co/pmUAzbPZA3

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Fidel Castro was a great friend to Africa, to countries in the Global South and to the Non-Aligned Movement. His place in history is assured

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I received with sadness the news of the death of Fidel Castro. My deepest condolences to the Government and people of Cuba.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I made it clear that I will remove ANY sign of padding in the 2017 budget document. It will NEVER happen again under my watch.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today, while receiving members of the Governance Support Group (GSG), I took the opportunity to comment again on the issue of budget padding

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Happy 70th birthday to @atiku. I'm glad to welcome him to the 70s Club, and wish him many more years of good health and service to Nigeria https://t.co/RjqOjgxCwB

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: RT @NGRPresident: The names of the first batch of 200,000 beneficiaries of @npower_ng Programme now up on the website: https://t.co/bQhUbFb…

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today in Akure I presented our Governorship candidate, Rotimi Akeredolu, to the people of Ondo State, at our grand finale campaign rally https://t.co/wnJ8fEKQvu

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me assure all Nigerians that our Government will continue to work to fulfill our promises on Security, the Economy & fighting Corruption

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm pleased that those who lost the Ondo primaries are still very much in the APC. That you lose elections doesn’t mean you should walk away

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm in Akure today for the grand finale Rally of our party's Governorship campaign. First I met with all our aspirants, and party leaders.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Yesterday I delivered Nigeria's National Statement at the High Level Segment of #COP22 https://t.co/myDwHw5AEE https://t.co/m991FXf1G6

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Profound gratitude to His Majesty King Mohammed VI of Morocco for the hospitality. And congrats to #COP22 Pres @Salahmezouar on his election https://t.co/3eEARnOIbA

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: For us in Nigeria, the issue of Climate Change is actually about survival. This is why we need to pay attention—https://t.co/4xgH9iGnqD

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Arrived to a warm welcome in Morocco. Tomorrow I will deliver Nigeria's Statement at the Opening Plenary of the #COP22 High Level Segment. https://t.co/q2m1wDrDaI

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I swore in the new Acting Chief Justice of Nigeria, Hon Justice Walter Onnoghen. He succeeds the retiring Justice Mahmud Mohammed. https://t.co/Rf9ODNSxu3

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On my visit to Edo State earlier this week I was very impressed by the work Gov Adams Oshiomhole has done in infrastructure development

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I look forward to working together with President-elect Trump to build on and strengthen relations between Nigeria & the USA

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On behalf of the Govt and people of Nigeria, I congratulate President-elect @realDonaldTrump on his victory in the US presidential election.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will work with the State Govt and security agencies to find a lasting solution to the problem of armed banditry in the state and region.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: These killings are utterly condemnable. I am in touch with Governor @YariAbubakar; and being briefed on ongoing investigations.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I commiserate with the Government and people of Zamfara on the cold-blooded murder, by armed bandits, of 36 persons at Bindin in Maru LGA.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: May the souls of the departed rest in peace, and may Almighty God grant their families and colleagues the fortitude to bear this tragic loss

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Extraordinary officer & men, who laid down their lives that Nigeria might be free from the terror of Boko Haram. You will never be forgotten

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 7. Pte Salisu Lawal

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 6. Able Seaman Patrick Paul (Nigerian Navy)

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 5. Cpl Chukwu Simon

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 4. Sgt Bassey Okon

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 3. Sgt Hussani Jafaru

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 2. Sgt Muazu Ibrahim

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: 1. Lt Col Muhammad Abu-Ali

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Not many people may remember: I spent most of the 40 months of my detention, following the 1985 coup, in a small bungalow here in Benin City

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm glad to be visiting Edo State, to commission Infrastructure projects completed by the administration of Gov Adams Oshiomhole https://t.co/FSHvwCnaRA

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I call on members of the Armed Forces to not allow this tragic incident dampen their spirits and resolve. Evil will not triumph over good.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have also personally conveyed my condolences to the late Lt. Col Ali's father, Brigadier-Gen. Abu Ali (Rtd), and his widow, Samira.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: No words can do justice to the patriotism and remarkable courage of these soldiers, who laid down their lives for Nigeria.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I received the news of the deaths with shock. Lt. Col. Abu Ali was an extraordinary officer who inspired respect among those he commanded.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have asked Chief of Staff Abba Kyari to lead a delegation to represent me at the funeral of Lt Col Abu Ali & other fallen heroes, tomorrow

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: No man, woman, or child will be left at the mercy of Boko Haram. This has always been our promise, and we fully intend to keep it.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I commend our troops, who continue to work gallantly to secure the people and territory of Nigeria. You are our heroes.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I've received the heartwarming news of the rescue of another of our Chibok Girls, by the Nigerian Army.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: In Sokoto I commissioned the 500-Unit Kalambaina Housing Estate completed by the administration of Governor @AWTambuwal https://t.co/OU6U2udKRb

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I attended a Mini Durbar to celebrate the 10th Anniversary of the Sultan of Sokoto, Muhammadu Sa’ad Abubakar III. Long may he reign. https://t.co/iwuSsyHIx1

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Heartfelt Condolences to the family of Sir Olaniwun Ajayi, the entire Afenifere, and the Govt & people of Ogun State, on his passing.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This aft I received in audience Senate Pres @bukolasaraki. The Executive & Legislature will continue to work together for Nigeria's progress https://t.co/DusSsP9jul

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: This afternoon I received the Executive Committee Members of the Christian Association of Nigeria – 19 Northern States and Abuja. https://t.co/tG3dan2wiM

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: When there is peace,we will all benefit. Nobody will invest in an insecure environment. We must cooperate to make Nigeria work for all of us

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I told the Leaders that they have more to do than anyone else to bring peace to the N/Delta,given the influence they have on militant groups

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Nigeria cannot thrive if any part of it is trapped in conflict and violence. We have to give peace a chance in the Niger Delta.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We are currently reviewing the implementation of the Niger Delta Amnesty Programme, to determine the shortcomings, and areas for reform

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The issues presented ranged from Infrastructure needs to the strengthening of institutions like the NDDC, and matters of fiscal federalism.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: At our meeting today the Leaders and Stakeholders of the Niger Delta, led by Chief Edwin Clark, presented a list of 16 issues for dialogue.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Meeting with Niger Delta Stakeholders this afternoon: Governors, former Govs, Ministers, Legislators, Traditional Rulers, Activists, Youths

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We will protect the lives and wellbeing of these most vulnerable of Nigeria's citizens. And we will ensure they return safely to their homes

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Let me assure that these very distressing reports will not be taken lightly. We will act decisively on the findings of the investigations.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I have seen the new @hrw report, and asked the Inspector-General of Police and concerned State Governors to investigate immediately

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Deeply worrying to hear the reports of sexual abuse and exploitation of women and girls by security personnel in IDP camps in the Northeast

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: When the world stands together, it will be impossible for evil to triumph over good.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Days after the attempt on the holy city of Makkah, Maiduguri suffered an attack. We must rally together & not allow ourselves to be cowed.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I told @KingSalman that we must not relent in our efforts to strengthen Int'l coalition in the fight against terrorism and violent extremism

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I spoke with Saudi @KingSalman Al Saud to express #Nigeria's solidarity following the missile attack on the holy city of Makkah

text:

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I approved nomination of 46 non-career Ambassadors-Designate, in addition to the 47 Career Ambassadors-Designate I nominated in June

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I urge all to honour Ken Jnr.'s memory by supporting us to make his dream of an environmentally safe and prosperous Ogoni land a reality.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The world salutes the late Saro-Wiwa Jnr.'s dedication to the clean-up of Ogoni land, after the death of his father, Ken Saro-Wiwa

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I spoke with Ken Saro-Wiwa Jnr.'s widow, to express condolences, on behalf of myself & the nation, on the death of her husband

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Today I received 21 dear daughters. They have seen the worst that the world has to offer. It is now time for them to experience the best.

text: Productive discussions on security and economic cooperation today, with German Chancellor Angela Merkel & team at the Chancellery in Berlin https://t.co/W9G2PwaOES

text:

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Cooperation on the security & humanitarian situation in the Northeast will form a significant part of my discussions with Chancellor Merkel

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: The Department of State Services (DSS) has briefed me on the matter, and will continue to provide updates.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: As I depart Abuja for Germany on an Official Visit, I welcome the release of 21 of our Chibok Girls, following successful negotiations.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I commend our military for their unflagging efforts. This attack has further strengthened our resolve to completely neutralize Boko Haram.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Unable to hold territory, the severely degraded terrorist group now occasionally resorts to cowardly attacks on soft targets.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am disheartened by the news of the bomb blast in Maiduguri. My condolences to the families of the victims, and the Borno State Government.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I am delighted the theme of #NES22 is 'Made In Nigeria'. I acknowledge all Champions of Made-in-Nig, who have defied the odds over the years https://t.co/zJGUHB4mEo

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I declared #NES22 open this morning. In my Address I noted that we need to diversify the Economy so we never again depend on one commodity. https://t.co/wbeJYtTWOa

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations to @NGSuperEagles on the weekend victory! The first step in a long journey. Nigerians are looking forward to Russia 2018!

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Former President Obasanjo visited this afternoon. Always a pleasure to discuss Governance & national issues with him https://t.co/7WYFAjvss5

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Congratulations to @GEJonathan and Prof Attahiru Jega, joint winners with me of the @LeadershipNGA 2015 "Person of the Year" Award

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: On this #WorldTeachersDay I remember Kasimu Adamu Zangon-Daura, my Junior Primary School Teacher. Who is the first Teacher you remember?

text: RT @AsoRock: PMB: "I know how difficult things are, and how rough business is. In every part of our nation people are making incredible sac…

text: Today Prof JN Paden, whom I've known for many years,presented his biography of me. I commend his intellectual effort https://t.co/KDC7Q2rS5e

text: I wish all Nigerians a Happy 56th Independence Anniversary.  #NigeriaAt56 https://t.co/NVLrjswb0S

text: Congratulations to the Govt and people of Edo State on the successful conclusion of #EdoDecides, and the victory of Godwin Obaseki

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: Shimon Peres served his country firmly, faithfully and dutifully, and stands as an enduring symbol of love, magnanimity and understanding.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: My sincere condolences to the Govt & people of the State of Israel on the passing of former President & Prime Minister, Shimon Peres

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I'm happy to be back home, after spending the week in New York for UNGA. Grateful to all the officials who helped make the trip successful.

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: I wish King Sunny Ade a happy 70th birthday today. KSA has taken African music to the world, and brought great pride to Nigeria and Africa

text:

name: Muhammadu Buhari
text: We had a good meeting with @POTUS. I thanked him for the immense support in the fight against Boko Haram. Also wished him a happy retirement
